Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we‚Äôve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What‚Äôs it like to work at Cabify?

We‚Äôre a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

‚åöHybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

üí∂Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K‚Ç¨]

üèùÔ∏èRecharge days

üåçOur office is located in Madrid.

‚åöFlexible work environment & hours.

üôåRegular team events.

üöóCabify staff free rides.

üöÄPersonal development programs based on our career paths.

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

üìêCoursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

üí≥Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

üíªAll the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

üê±A pet room, so you don‚Äôt have to leave your furry friend at home

‚òïÔ∏èAnd last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!




It would be a big plus if you

Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.


KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market


YOUR CHALLENGE

  • You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
  • Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
  • You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
  • You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
  • You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
  • Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
  • You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
  • Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
  • During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!


YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

  • You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
  • You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
  • You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
  • You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
  • You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
  • You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
  • You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
  • You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
  • You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!


It would be a big plus if you

  • Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
  • Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders


SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass


BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

  • Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
  • Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
  • Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
  • Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.


Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we‚Äôd like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities



Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
Build Insights reports weekly.
Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns



About You



Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
Industry experience is a must
Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) ‚Äì the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.



At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI‚Äîmanaged by the industry‚Äôs best and most diverse digital talent‚Äîto help the world‚Äôs trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger‚Äôs Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek‚Äôs first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents‚Äîand resonates with‚Äîthe world around us.

While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

  • Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
  • Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
  • Build Insights reports weekly.
  • Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
  • Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
  • Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
  • Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
  • Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns


About You


  • Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
  • Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
  • Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
  • Industry experience is a must
  • Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
  • Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
  • Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
  • Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
  • Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
  • Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
  • Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
  • Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) ‚Äì the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.


At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger‚Äôs Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek‚Äôs first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents‚Äîand resonates with‚Äîthe world around us.

While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a driven and successful Data Analyst to help our client sales teams worldwide grow, meet, and exceed their business targets.




As a Data Analyst focused on supporting the Sales team, you will be responsible for building and maintaining data and reporting capabilities, performing in-depth analysis of sales patterns, estimating the effectiveness of monetisation efforts, and providing actionable insights to both the sales teams and management.




You will contribute to key areas such as lead generation, user attribution infrastructure, and monetisation solutions, playing a critical role in driving revenue growth and expanding the brand‚Äôs customer base.




We need someone who is highly proficient with data infrastructure and reporting tools, understands the sales domain, and is genuinely interested in driving business outcomes.




What‚Äôs in it for you?




Great salary | High impact role | Scale up with high potential | Career growth | 100% Remote




Responsibilities:




Support the data infrastructure for sales: the company already has a basic data infrastructure in place, including a data warehouse (Redshift), integrated sales tools, and basic sales reporting in Tableau. They expect you to adapt this infrastructure to accommodate changes, develop more advanced reports, build new integrations, and ensure the quality and accuracy of the data.
Regularly report on the performance of the sales teams: Help develop and track appropriate KPIs.
Perform deep analysis of sales data: Focus primarily on internal data but also include external data where possible. Identify patterns and provide insights regarding offers, strategy changes, lead quality, and market shifts.
Work directly with sales teams, management, and, when necessary, marketing/development: Visualise and explain sales metrics and insights at various levels of complexity.
Form hypotheses, suggest improvements, and organise testing: Collaborate with the teams to test these hypotheses and implement improvements.




Requirements:




3+ years of experience in analytics/BI, ideally related to sales or marketing domains.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree, ideally with a focus on business administration, marketing, economics, or data processing (optional‚Äîcan be omitted if not critical).
Strong technical skills: Advanced SQL, ideally Python for automating tasks; understanding of basic statistics and A/B testing; experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker); and the ability to work with raw data.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to derive insights, form, and test hypotheses to improve business results.
Sales domain knowledge (familiarity with sales data and reporting, CRM systems, lead generation, and sales processes) is a significant advantage.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal: Ability to clearly explain complex analytical concepts to different audiences, from sales agents to company management.
Obsession with business results: Understanding of business impact and the ability to work independently or within a team to continuously improve outcomes.
Fluency in English (native-level preferred). Spanish is a significant advantage; Russian would also be beneficial.
Experience working with B2B apps in a growth stage is also a plus.




Ready to make a significant impact? If you‚Äôre a driven Data Analyst with a passion for sales and marketing analytics, we want to hear from you! Apply now via Prosperity and help drive growth and success for our client‚Äôs sales teams worldwide.

Title: Data Analyst & BI - Remoto Espa√±a
Description:
The Wise Seeker is the leading HR technology company in unbiased talent evaluation.With over 15 years in the industry analyzing the needs and demands of the job market, we are capable of identifying the best talent for each company thanks to our team of professionals and our SaaS platform integrated with Artificial Intelligence.We are efficient, evaluate talent objectively without bias, and close hiring times in record time, delivering optimal results.

As a Data Analyst & BI Specialist, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and developing BI solutions to support strategic decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data models and visualizations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and decision-making.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to improve business processes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and BI.


Benefits


Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance (f/m/d)
Description:
Purpose of Position

Awin‚Äôs Financial Analysts serve as a pivotal resource in shaping the company's financial future and strategic direction through expert data analysis and insightful financial modelling. This role enhances decision-making across the organisation by providing precise, data-driven insights and actionable recommendations to optimise performance and drive growth.

Key Tasks


Financial & Business Analytics Reporting: Develop and maintain reporting using Tableau to track key performance indicators, financial metrics, and other critical data points relevant to business operations
Financial Modelling: Create detailed financial models that forecast business performance and simulate various financial scenarios to aid in strategic planning and decision-making
Insight Generation: Analyse data and report outcomes to provide actionable insights that support business objectives and drive efficiency improvements
Stakeholder Communication: Present complex analysis and reports to stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner, ensuring that technical and non-technical audiences understand the implications and insights
Continuous Improvement: Continually refine and enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting processes using BI tools to better meet the company‚Äôs strategic needs.


Skills & Expertise


3+ years in a financial or business analytics position
Analytical, pro-active and inquisitive, with the ability to take ownership and deliver projects independently
The ideal candidate possesses exceptional communication skills, with a proven ability to distil complex technical concepts into clear, concise explanations for non-technical audiences
Proficiency with SQL and Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau is essential
Fluency in English (C1+)


Our Offer


Flexi-Week and Work-Life Balance: We prioritise your mental health and wellbeing, offering you a flexible four-day Flexi-Week at full pay and with no reduction to your annual holiday allowance. We also offer a variety of different paid special leaves.
Flexi-Office: Do you prefer to work from our cool office, from home, or in a completely different environment? With us, the choice is yours. We‚ÄØoffer the flexibility to work wherever you want‚ÄØwithin our Awin locations.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Health & Well Being: With our support and access to various initiatives and sports offers, you can devote yourself to your mental and physical well-being.
Development: We‚Äôve built our extensive training suite Awin Academy to cover a wide range of skills that nurture you professionally and personally, with trainings conveniently packaged together to support your overall development. You can also improve your English skills by participating in our local language course.
Remote Working: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program and show your appreciation‚ÄØfor‚ÄØcolleagues who have gone‚ÄØthe extra mile‚ÄØto support‚ÄØyou.


Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we‚Äôve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‚ÄòLife @ Awin‚Äô hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world‚Äôs leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

  • Remote Working: You will receive a monthly allowance to cover part of your running costs. In addition, we will support you in setting up your remote workspace appropriately.
  • Appreciation: Thank and reward colleagues by sending them a voucher through our peer-to-peer program and show your appreciation‚ÄØfor‚ÄØcolleagues who have gone‚ÄØthe extra mile‚ÄØto support‚ÄØyou.

Established in 2000, Awin is proud of our dynamic, social and inclusive culture.

Like all businesses, we‚Äôve had to adapt and nurture our culture in a virtual environment. Our virtual ‚ÄòLife @ Awin‚Äô hub brings our colleagues from across the globe together for various social activities.

Diversity & Inclusion are paramount to us, and we proudly pursue and hire diverse team members. We champion uniqueness and authenticity; this is who we are at our core. Our network of affiliate partnerships are diverse and transparent, as are the employees powering our vision to build the world‚Äôs leading open partner ecosystem. We welcome all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. If you need support at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Apply now to begin the next stage of your career at a progressive company that supports both your professional and personal development.

Title: Research and Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US




As one of the largest entrepreneurship networks globally, Bridge for Billions creates, designs, and manages entrepreneurship programs with foundations, corporations, and public entities that have benefited more than 5,000 entrepreneurs in more than 140 countries. We exist to enable more early-stage entrepreneurs of all kinds to thrive, generating jobs and solutions for everyone, so our economies sustainably meet the needs of all.




Bridge for Billions, recognized by Forbes 30 Under 30, Ashoka, and Acumen, has worked with more than 100 organizations such as Coca-Cola, Novartis, VISA, and institutions such as the United Nations or IDB Lab in the development of large-scale entrepreneurship programs. In 8 years, Bridge has grown to a team of more than 50 people from nearly 25 nationalities, with headquarters in Madrid, where most of our team is based; an emerging LatAm HQ in Guatemala, with a few team members; and a few people based in different places around the world.




JOB MISSION




The researcher will drive research and analysis efforts to generate actionable insights, facilitate knowledge sharing and dissemination, engage with stakeholders and clients to align on needs and expectations, and support marketing initiatives with simplified and creatively presented data. This role will ensure effective project management, development of research tools, and documentation of best practices to enhance organizational learning and strategic decision-making.







ROLES & CONTRIBUTIONS




Research (60% of time dedicated to this role)

Design and implement rigorous research studies focused on entrepreneurship ecosystems.
Produce impact reports and publications on best practices.
Use advanced statistical and analytical tools to interpret data and extract meaningful insights.
Scope markets and develop tailored research tools and instruments.
Collect and manage large datasets ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Perform benchmarks against industry standards and competitors.
Ensure effective project management and adherence to research best practices.




Reports and Communication (20% of time dedicated to this role)

Produce highly accurate and detailed reports based on research findings.
Use data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create clear and compelling visual reports.
Present findings and participate in events to showcase thought leadership.
Simplify complex content and develop creative methods for data presentation.
Support marketing initiatives with simplified and creatively presented data.
Engage with academic, business, and professional communities to elevate the organization‚Äôs profile.




Internal Knowledge Management (20% of time dedicated to this role)

Develop a robust roadmap strategy for implementing knowledge management that builds upon industry best practices and leverages tooling and process advancements.
Document best practices and ensure lessons learned are shared across teams.
Support the continuous improvement of processes and systems through strategic insights derived from organizational data.
Build and drive the culture of knowledge sharing within the organization.
Create, capture, organize, and assess knowledge assets for enterprise use.







SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED




Skills we look for this particular role:




Hard Skills

Educational Background: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Knowledge Management, Data or Information Science, Business Administration, Economy, or a related field.
Minimum 2 years of experience in a knowledge management, research, or analytical role.
Proven track record in conducting qualitative and quantitative research.
Experience in preparing impact reports, best practices publications, ecosystem analysis, etc.
Experience communicating with and influencing senior leadership as well as framing discussions to gain valuable feedback and experience.
Ability to conduct thorough literature reviews.
Expertise in developing research tools and instruments.
Thought leadership and ability to contribute to best practices publications.
Familiarity with knowledge management systems and documentation tools.




Soft Skills

Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Experience leading projects and delivering outcomes within tight timelines.
Ability to simplify complex content and present data creatively.
Capability to provide actionable recommendations based on an analysis.
Proactive in knowledge sharing and contributing to thought leadership.
Strong documentation and internal knowledge management abilities.
Excellent understanding of impact management theory and practices, including Theory of Change.




Skills we look for all Bridge team members:

Purpose Driven: This position aligns with your life's purpose, the impact you wish to make, and the person you want to become.
Values Aligned: You embody our core values of Courage, Grit, Empathy, and Gumption.
Startup Mindset: You're collaborative, entrepreneurial, and willing to take responsibility for your work outcomes, operating effectively even when working alone.
Proactive & Empathetic: You take initiative, are results-driven, and empathetic in all your interactions with team members, entrepreneurs, mentors, and partners.
Emotionally Intelligent: You have a deep understanding of people‚Äôs needs and expectations and can build trust and engagement quickly.
Passionate & Curious: You are passionate about your work and have a lifelong desire to learn.
Resilient: You have a growth mindset and the resilience to overcome challenges, understanding that systemic change requires hard work.
Effective Communicator: You have proven experience in resolving problems and communicating complex ideas clearly to diverse groups in a fast-paced environment.




RECRUITMENT PROCESS




Apply: Submit your application.
Initial Chat: A brief 30-45 minute conversation to discuss your interest and understand the role.
Business Case: You'll receive a challenge to complete within a set time frame.
Technical Interview: If your challenge is satisfactory, we'll discuss it further and assess your technical skills.
Mutual Interview: An open discussion where you can ask us any questions to ensure our company is the right fit for you.
References: With your consent, we'll contact two of your references for feedback.
Offer: If all goes well, you'll receive a job offer from us.




OFFER AND LOCATION




Transparent salaries and fair compensation structure, mid-range for the social sector:




Compensation: Annual salary ranging from ‚Ç¨25,000-‚Ç¨30,000
Benefits Package: Includes health insurance through Alan and a flexible benefits program with Cobee, which covers expenses from meals to childcare and training.
Location: Madrid
Starting Date: We're eager to start as soon as we find the perfect fit.
Employment Type: This is a full-time position. This position includes a 6-month trial period to assess suitability and performance




IMPACT & TEAM




Our Vision: We're set on reshaping the entrepreneurship landscape to be more just, inclusive, and effective.
Make a Real Impact: Join us in aiding entrepreneurs worldwide. As a part of our team, you'll be at the heart of a rapidly evolving social enterprise.
Team Dynamics: We're a passionate, international crew with a shared mission. See what our team members are saying on Glassdoor.
Company Values: Our four pillars are Gumption, Courage, Grit, and Empathy.
Referral Incentive: Receive a $200 bonus for successful team referrals ($100 upon hiring and an added $100 after their first 6 months).




GROWTH & DEVELOPMENT




Annual Global Retreats: Join us in global company-wide retreats, geared toward alignment and leadership growth, facilitated by external professionals.
Personal Growth: Take advantage of a dedicated learning budget, tailored for needs like backend bootcamps or leadership training sessions.
Feedback-Centered Culture: Engage in monthly one-on-ones with your lead and partake in comprehensive quarterly reviews with your peers.
Skill Sharing: We value cross-training. Team members are urged to share expertise through talks and in-house training.




WELLBEING & TIME OFF




Vacation Days: You'll have 23 vacation days, with the option to add more, in addition to chosen local public holidays.




FLEXIBILITY & WORK SET-UP




Tech Ready: We'll equip you with a new or second-hand Macbook.
Flexible Work Options: Enjoy a blend of flexible work hours and the option to work remotely.
Office Location: If you're in Madrid, our centrally-located office awaits, complete with a bright ambiance, modern amenities, and a welcoming terrace ideal for team gatherings.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
My client in the financial services industry is looking for a Business Data Analyst on an autonomo contract (6-12 months) with it extending to a 2-3 years project. It will be on a hybrid basis in the office 3 days a week in Madrid.




Responsibilities

Main responsible of Business requirement gathering, User Story writing and lead User Story refinement efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Participate together with engineers on the design of the solution.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Can understand business processes and suggest improvements to the data platform.




Requirements

Data Architecture / Data Modelling knowledge.
Python Programming for Data.
Expert in Data Analysis / SQL Programming.
Must have strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
Understanding of REST APIs / SOAP APIs ( ability to read / understand technical specifications)
Experienced in Microsoft Power BI (ability to design prototypes to support requirements)







If interested, please apply and I will be in touch to discuss the role.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Lingokids' mission is to help 100 million families worldwide raise amazing kids through playlearning‚Ñ¢.




Through play and interactive technology, Lingokids delivers premium, modern learning through educational subjects and life skills so kids can thrive as confident, conscious, resilient, lifelong learners ‚Äî ready for school and today‚Äôs ever-changing world.




Are you ready for Playlearning?‚Ñ¢




We‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Product Data Analyst to join our team who is passionate about analysing data, identifying trends, and making recommendations to improve our growth strategies. As a key member of our team, you will work closely with Product Managers to improve user experience.




Responsibilities

Analyse user and interaction data to identify patterns, trends, and insights related to product usage and growth.
Collaborate with product managers to develop A/B testing strategies, implement tests, and analyse results to optimise product features and user flows.
Create reports and dashboards that track key performance indicators (KPIs) for product and monetisation.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders based on data analysis to drive product improvements and growth strategy adjustments.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, tools, and practices related to product led growth and monetisation.
Own analytics projects E2E. Define business problems, translate into data approaches for yourself and more junior members of the team, and deliver insight and tools that will drive change.




Desired experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Marketing or a related field.
Proven experience working in a similar role, focusing on product or monetisation and data analysis in a fast growth business.
You have deep expertise in data focussed tools (e.g., SQL, Python) and techniques, and have a history of delivering impactful projects from start to finish.
Experience with data analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude, Looker) and A/B testing tools and techniques.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and persuasive manner.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Creative problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.
You‚Äôre a bright, high calibre candidate who enjoys working in a warm, fast-paced and collaborative environment.




English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English so, we don't care about certificates, but we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.




You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. We have become a fully remote company so, we believe that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.




Experience working closely with non-technical stakeholders to refine requirements and bring them to life is a must.




Life at Lingokids

üè° Remote working: you can choose to work remotely from within your country or visit our offices if you live in Madrid.

‚öñÔ∏è Flexible hours and work-life balance: we care about the results you bring to the team. 9 to 6 and constant commuting is not for us either.

üìà Stock options: joining Lingokids means you can choose to own part of the company.

üåç Visa sponsorship: if you need a visa to work in the EU, Lingokids will assist you during the visa process, costs included.

üìö Professional growth: up to ‚Ç¨2.000 per year for conferences, books, and training.

üí¨ Language lessons: language learning is what we‚Äôre all about! We‚Äôll cover language classes for you to learn Spanish, English or Portuguese.

ü©∫ Health Insurance: we offer an optional health insurance through Adeslas, featuring competitive rates to ensure your well-being.

üß† Mental Health Support: we offer you 4 free TherapySide sessions to support your self-awareness and well-being

üí≥ Flexible compensation: you'll be able to include your monthly expenses in meals and transportations into your payroll (we use Cobee).

üç≤ Meal allowances: every month, you will receive a 60‚Ç¨ allowance on your Cobee card for you to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services.

üñ• Home office setup: you'll have a 400‚Ç¨ allowance in your first payroll to set up your home office and a 35‚Ç¨ monthly allowance for remote expenses.

üôå Feedback culture: feedback is the breakfast of champions, and we take it seriously! We have a real-time and honest feedback culture, and a formal 360¬∫ assessment every 6 months.




If you think you don't tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you. Nobody checks every box, and we are looking for someone excited to join the team!

Title: KPI Analyst
Description:
Here at CORUS we are looking for a KPI Analyst to join our team in an international project.




The candidate‚Äôs key responsibilities will focus on collecting, maintaining, forecasting and reporting our KPIs.




Location: remote from Spain.




Duration: Six months (it might extend).







Your Role

As KPI Analyst you will:

Raising awareness, providing guidance and training to the organization on key dimensions and insights of our program to drive actions.
Develop all KPI reporting required for: Business Review preparation, annual and 3-year target setting, annual target assessment, HR reporting, Finance reporting, Investor Relations reporting, ad hoc requests (Bloomberg index, Dow Jones sustainability etc.).
Forecast and scenario planning as the year progresses or given changes in KPI structure e.g. volume changes.
Contribute to the quarterly Action Program reporting ensuring accurate and timely inputs and results which highlight gaps in performance.
Developing and maintain an annual calendar of KPI reporting reflecting business processes, key decision points and business investment impacting KPI performance.
Drive the combination of data sources to link metric with Financial KPIs strengthening relevance to decision making and impact on performance e.g. data modelling or correlation analysis linking KPIs with financials.
Develop and maintain a systematic database which accurately maintains KPI targets and performance and enables clear access for the appropriate stakeholders.
Translate analytic insights into concrete actionable recommendations, drawing conclusions for business improvement and influencing strategy effectively.




Required Skills and Experience

As KPI Analyst your skills and qualifications will include:

Passionate and curious about data analysis & identifying insights to facilitate action planning.
Ability to work with larger sets of data (like Excel, SPSS,...) to provide additional/ad-hoc analysis (creating cuts of data based on different stakeholder requirements in addition to agency results packs).
Analytical mindset with ability to translate from numbers to business implications.
Bachelor's or master's degree (e.g., in business studies/administration, research, data science, psychology, behaviour science, customer or change management), 5 years+ of experience in analytics role.
Experience of managing and delivering KPIs and analytics.
Experience of building systematic processes to ensure accurate and timely reporting to all levels within the organization.
Strong attention to detail and focus on accuracy avoiding errors.
Experience of conducting statistical analytics e.g. correlation or modelling to combined customer and financial data.




What do we offer:

Remote work from Spain.
Flexible remuneration and a personalized training plan.
People-focused team.
Dynamic work environment, with real possibilities for professional growth.
International projects of high technological value.




At CORUS we are very conscious of the importance of respecting diversity. No one will be excluded from this call for applications on the grounds of race, colour, age, sex, marital status, ideology, political opinions, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and/or any other personal, physical or social condition. This process is aimed at choosing the best professionals through a selection process based exclusively on merit and skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

We are South Europe Technologies (S.ET); the IT, Data and Operations Shared Service Center of BNP Paribas Personal Finance, with delivery centers in Spain and Portugal, providing the best solutions to BNPP PF entities around the world such as Cetelem (specialized, between others, in financial partnership of major retailers, consumer goods companies and car dealerships).

Among Other Services, Our Portfolio Is Composed Of


Applications Management (Architecture, Project Management, Development, and Quality Assurance).
IT Risks & Cybersecurity Services.
Platforms Management.
Data Analytics and AI.
Operations.



Our offices are in Spain (Madrid) and Portugal (Lisbon, Porto). The company brings together over 200+ employees, with expertise in various technologies (Java, .Net, Python, Tibco, APIGee) and other operational roles (Functional Analyst, Project Manager, Business Analyst, Auto Stock Financing operators). We keep growing!

Our consistent track record of services delivery means comfort for our customers and opportunities for our employees.

You will find SE.T to be full of energy and an Inclusive Workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Would you like to join our international team that delivers end-to-end solutions (applications and operations activities) to businesses of BNP Paribas Personal Finance Group entities around the world?

In a context of maintaining the high level of existing activities while growing the number of international customers, we are looking for our Data Analyst.

Mission

We are searching for the best talent to provide analytical and reporting support to the Data Office perimeter to optimize decision making and develop cross-functional data products.

Main Responsibilities


Perform data analysis: Provide conclusions, propose improvements, identify, or solve problems, or investigate business questions based on data.
Reporting: Implement and analyze data plans based on the measurement needs of your internal customers. Automate reports, design, and manage the publication of dashboards on visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Technically responsible for the data domains under the responsibility of the Data Office: Support to the definition and implementation of controls, management of registrations and modifications of the necessary views in the Information Center/Datahub, etc.
Manage the technical development of analytical products by coordinating resources from Central analytical Hubs: Reporting, ML models, ad-hoc analysis, data exploration, etc.
Contribute to the proposals on technological platforms and governance model elaborated by the Data Office with its opinion and experience.



What We Are Looking For


Academic background: Degree / Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Big Data or equivalent experience.
You have two years of proven working experience in the data transformation to extract key insights using statistical/analytical concepts.
Proven experience in execution and automation of ETL's based on SAS, SQL or others.
Knowledge of Phyton, Dataiku and Dremio.
You are engaged in day-to-day activities.
You have a transformation mindset, looking for the excellency.
You are a Problem-Solving and Decision-Making person, who:
Demonstrates advanced analytical and diagnostic skills dealing with issues that are ambiguous, lack known precedent or appear contradictory.
Sees the big picture and is fully aware of technology and business directions.
Has department, corporate and group objectives in focus while identifying and removing barriers.



Skills


Communication skills - Oral & Written.
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork.
Proactivity.
Organized, efficient, and able to meet deadlines.
Gives and welcomes feedback. Puts success of the business and team above own interest.
Experience in the Finance sector is a plus.
Management of the MS Office package (Excel, Power Point, SharePoint, One Note knowledge).
Management of visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
Fluent level of English and Spanish is a must. Any other European language is nice to have.



About Our Culture

We are proud to create, maintain and develop business solutions for BNP Paribas Group entities around the world, while keeping a high level of service and providing added value to our customers.

Working in an Inclusive and Multicultural environment, we encourage everyone to develop their talents and skills, offering various career opportunities and internal mobility programs, within local SET teams or in other entities within the Group.

We value our employees' experience by keeping a well-balanced environment with flexibility regarding the work schedule and care for everyone's personal time.

We embraced a hybrid way of working because we believe social connection always adds value to our day-to-day activities.

Benefits


Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
Flexible compensation plan.
Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
31 vacation days.



Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!

Job Description

The Opportunity

Reporting to the VP of Platform Intelligence, the Data Analyst ‚Äì Platform Intelligence is part of a cross-departmental discipline at Cint that provides insight on how our algorithms influence feasibility, delivery, and financial performance. These insights are used to improve our products to achieve financial targets and ensure our platform is optimized to deliver at full potential.

The incumbent will collaborate closely with Product and Technology stakeholders and will consult with Commercial, Operations and Finance teams to understand, explain, and predict how platform algorithms affect clients and partners.

What You Will Do


Develop a comprehensive, nuanced, and predictive understanding of sample ecosystem dynamics (price elasticity, demand/supply clearing) and their underlying mechanics
With Cint‚Äôs Product Managers and engineers, enhance our products to confidently achieve predicted outcomes and optimize delivery
Provide advisory support to Product Development teams for subjects related to Platform Intelligence and/or insight driven product development
Create deliverables that express ecosystem dynamics simply and effectively to senior-level audiences, such as:
Visualizations of ecosystem metrics and trend analysis
Trend reports that track the impact and effectiveness of yield operations over time
Decision support documents for high-risk changes
Recommendations for development of Supply pipeline for commercial teams
Recommendations for development of Demand pipeline for commercial teams

Qualifications

What We Are Looking For:


Few years of working experience with pricing analytics and marketing or behavioral analytics
Previous experience with online market research methods/products is strongly preferred.
Explaining and defending analytical techniques in front of lay audiences
Experience with SQL and in working with large-scale databases
Experience with statistical computing languages like Python, R (statistical and data manipulation packages)
Experience in creating and maintaining dashboards using reporting or BI tool
Highly accountable self-starter and quick learner who is driven to deliver
Multiculturally competent
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to create data stories to drive product innovation
Ability to understand the big picture as well ensure the accuracy of details
Passionate about driving value using data and technology


Additional Information

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in Python,SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!

The role is based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:


Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one¬¥s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance


Skills and requirements:


+2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus


Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:


Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - TicketRestaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28countries
And more!


Powered by JazzHR

Title: BI Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Job Summary This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining business intelligence solutions using Microsoft Power BI. The role involves analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to provide actionable insights that support business decision-making and enhance organizational performance. The role also includes developing automated processes and integrating analytics to drive efficiencies and innovation. Effective communication and collaboration with business stakeholders are essential to ensure alignment and successful presentation of developed solutions.

Responsibilities


Develops and maintains Power BI reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Analyzes complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
Designs and implements automated data processing and analytics workflows to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Partners with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into actionable BI solutions.
Ensures data quality and integrity by implementing robust data governance and validation processes.
Collaborates with data engineering teams to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring seamless integration of data from various sources.
Leads and mentors a team of BI developers, providing guidance, training, and support to junior team members.
Communicates project progress, challenges, and solutions to stakeholders effectively, ensuring alignment and timely delivery.
Represents the BI team in cross-functional projects, driving the implementation of BI solutions and ensuring their alignment with business objectives.
Continuously evaluates and improves existing BI methodologies, staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in the field.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Preferred Certifications


Microsoft Power BI Certification
SQL Certification


Knowledge & Skills


Microsoft Power BI
SQL (Programming Language)
Data Analysis
Data Visualization
Data Warehousing
Business Intelligence
Data Governance
Automation (e.g., Power Automate, RPA tools)
Statistical Analysis
Basic knowledge of programming languages (e.g., Python, R) is a plus
Effective Communication
Project Management
Stakeholder Management
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader, providing direction to team activities and facilitating information validation and team decision-making processes.

Title: Climate Data Analyst
Description:
Climate Data Specialist, Zurich Resilience Solutions, 80%-100%

At Zurich Resilience Solutions (ZRS) we‚Äôre committed to supporting our customers and business partners through harnessing the expertise in our global network.

We have a brand new role to help shape and grow our business which is going from strength to strength.

Your role in our Climate Resilience team is to support in the development, and deployment of state-of-the-art risk assessment methods and tools. In this role you will be working closely with customer facing business units as well as internal technical functions within Zurich Insurance (e.g. Group Accumulation Management, Group Re, Commercial Insurance Underwriting) towards sourcing and developing climate data and tools for our customers. Your core responsibility in this role is to source, analyze, and visualize data sets (hazard, exposures, controls) to support in the assessment of natural hazards and climate change risks.

What You Will Do

As a Climate Data Specialist your main responsibilities will involve:

Technical Developments


Support the development and continuous update of climate and natural hazards data
Monitor global sustainability regulations and frameworks to identify needs in terms of climate data and develop these.
Support in the development of data processing and visualization tools


Customer Projects


Source and analyse data from internal and open-source databases.
Transform natural hazard and climate change exposure data into key messages and insights/conclusions to help customers build climate change resilience.


Communication


Creation, maintenance and internal sharing of natural hazard and climate change training and knowledge content
Facilitate climate data knowledge sharing across the CCRS community, as well as other internal stakeholders and customers


What You Bring

As Climate Data Specialist your skills and qualifications will ideally include:


Master‚Äôs degree in natural/environmental/atmospheric sciences.
Deep understanding of Climate Change and Natural Hazards science, models, and their practical implementation.
Experience in spatial data management, climate data, spatial analysis, and visualization, big datasets, transforming data into insights for decision-making.
The ability to clearly communicate complicated concepts in a concise and compelling manner to all levels of management and stakeholders of various levels of technical proficiency.
High level of proficiency in data analytics and tools for visualization of spatial data and software, e.g. Power BI, ArcGIS, and programming languages (R, Python, etc.).
Fluent in written and spoken English at a technical level with strong customer service orientation. Any other language is an asset.


Additional Information

We look forward to receiving your online application.

Zurich wants to attract the best talent and we acknowledge that talents might not always be available full-time. At Zurich we will consider requests for flexible working. Many of our employees work flexibly in a variety of ways. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility you may need.

Information for recruitment agencies

Zurich does not accept any applications from recruitment agencies for this position. We refuse any responsibility for unsolicited applications as well as any associated fees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Company

Shalion is a data-driven company working for world-class manufacturers and brands worldwide. With its Digital Shelf Optimization and Retail Media solutions, Shalion provides innovative tools that facilitate e-commerce monitoring.

We, at Shalion, enable brands to make smarter business decisions in eCommerce, based on actionable data and insights providing information on online product prices, availability, share of search, etc. in more than 800 e-retailers and 50 different countries. Our client portfolio includes industry giants such as Heineken, Lego, Danone, and Nestl√©.

The role

As a Data Analyst at Shalion, your responsibilities include:


Developing and maintaining client and internal dashboards in Looker.
Collaborating with Product teams to shape the product roadmap based on customer feedback and market insights.
Translating business requirements into technical tasks, ensuring timely delivery.
Working closely with Data Engineers to expand and enhance datasets, contributing to roadmap planning.
Ensuring data quality and consistency across dashboards.
Translating product questions into actionable insights.
Support the team in solving problems and challenges related to reporting and information analysis to create best practices in data usage and consumption.


Your profile should include the following:


2+ years of experience working as a data analyst or visualization expert.
Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.
High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or Power BI.
Solid statistical background.
Experience working with business stakeholders and engineers.
Experience in data modeling for visualization.
Communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to structure information, analyze it, and extract data according to business needs


Ideally you will also have:


An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.
Experience with market research analysis.
Experience working with a modern cloud data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
Knowledge of Git and command-line
Prior experience modeling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).
UX skills.


Soft Skills:


Prioritization: Skillful at prioritizing tasks, gaining stakeholder buy-in, and resolving conflicts.
Resilience: Able to thrive in ambiguous situations and enjoy problem-solving.
Curiosity: Eagerness to learn and engage in constructive discussions.
Quality-oriented: Can discern data quality and value code testing for growth.


What We Offer You


The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
International environment with more than 10 nationalities
Fresh fruit every day
Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarri√†- Sant Gervasi).
Fixed-term contract.


Interview process


First interview HR screening
Second interview SQL assignment
Third interview CDO
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Barcelona, Spain

Hybrid

We are looking for an apprentice specialized in data analytics. Join a dynamic team in a complex Supply Chain and work for a leading perfumery company. We'll need you to leverage data in order to optimize supply chain, drive efficiency and enhance decision-making. We offer the chance to join a worldwide company promoting careers internally.

At dsm-firmenich people are at the heart of the company. We are committed to equal employment opportunities and value diversity in the workplace.

Your Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and organize data related to the supply chain, including data on suppliers, inventory, capacity, and Row materials.
Support regional IBP & operational processes, including inventory and supply chain management, Supply Planning, process management across AMET and EUR region.
Analyze data using statistical methods and software such as PBI, VBA, Python, or SQL to identify trends and patterns in the supply chain.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders, including senior management, developing dashboards to track progress over time.
Identify areas for improvement in the supply chain, such as reducing lead times, improving inventory management, and cost saving.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs). Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in supply chain management and data analysis.


We bring


A rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;
A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;
A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;
A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;
Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected ‚Äì regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;
A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;


You bring


Master's degree in Statistics, Engineering, data scientist, or equivalent.
Critical thinking and proactive work style.
Analytical skills.
Pro-active, positive attitude, and willing to learn.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, and other data analysis tools, to create and operate reports.
Knowledge is some code language software (SQL/ Python/VBA/M)
English is must, French/Spanish is a plus
