Title: Data & Analytics Junior Consultant - Azure
Description:
At EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we‚Äôre counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

In a fast-changing and uncertain world, the right insights make the difference between seizing an opportunity and missing it entirely. EY Knowledge helps EY to win in the market by providing the right insights at the right time through an agile, client-first organization.

The Oportunity

You will be the overall responsible for the development and execution of various projects, leading a team, ensuring the successful completion of all project phases from requirements gathering to production deployment. This includes the following aspects: technical-functional definition, ETL development and data modeling, visualization, as well as conducting training sessions and overseeing the rollout among other key aspects.

Primary Responsibilities

You will participate in the definition and functional analysis in close collaboration with the client, ensuring solutions tailored to their needs. You will work on a daily basis with SQL databases, data modeling using ETL tools, and data warehouse environments in Azure technology (i.e., Data Lake, Synapse, Data Factory, Power BI).

Your responsibilities will extend to internal and external training on relevant tools for the team, identifying necessary training and certifications for team growth. You will stay updated on the latest technological trends, with a particular emphasis on Data & Analytics, through continuous commitment to training and proactive exploration of new innovations in the sector.

You will closely collaborate with your Manager on operational activities, including team hour input management, forecasting analysis for the upcoming months, etc

Competencies / Skills:


Fluent in Spanish and English
Minimum of 1 year of experience working as a consultant/developer in data platforms, participating in end-to-end Data & Analytics projects
Education in Computer Engineering, Telecommunications, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, or holding a Higher Education degree or another academic path that has provided you with the capacity for development and critical thinking in this environment.
Additional training in Analytics, Big Data, or a similar discipline will be highly valued.
Communicative, analytical, and business-oriented skills to understand project contexts and assist in decision-making for our clients. Demonstrating a proactive and participatory attitude is important.
Proven abilities and experience in project management, teamwork, and adaptation to changing environments effectively while optimizing available resources. Results-oriented, independence, autonomy, dynamism, and freshness in decision-making, improvisation skills, and agility in day-to-day problem-solving.
Desirable to have worked in consulting firms to understand the needs and day-to-day dynamics of our organization. Solid knowledge in Data & Analytics technologies, with demonstrated experience in SQL development, ETL technologies, and visualization with a focus on Power BI. Knowledge in data modeling, with particular relevance to adaptation to Cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google). Previous experience in consumption of data coming from SAP sources is valuable.


Technical Skills


Microsoft Azure:
Data Factory
Synapse
Data Lake
Power BI
OpenAI
Machine Learning
AWS and Google Cloud as nice to haves


What We Offer


Continuous learning: You‚Äôll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We‚Äôll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We‚Äôll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You‚Äôll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

Title: Data Analyst, Retail Media
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Retail Media EMEA Analytics team, part of the rapidly expanding Criteo Retail Media business, leverages our grand set of shopper data to design and develop actionable insights for our Retailer and Brand clients. We bring the analytical perspective onto the business and provide recommendations based on high quality data analysis and strong understanding of our industry and products. We leverage our unique position to provide our commercial teams and clients with visibility into shopper behavior, market trends and product performance that can't be found anywhere else.

Criteo‚Äôs high-growth business model brings both opportunities and challenges. This position requires working with large sets of data and a variety of stakeholders to solve complex business problems by thinking strategically and proposing innovative solutions. The ideal candidate functions with minimal oversight and has the ability to learn new concepts quickly.


Mine massive data sets and turn them into understandable and actionable insights
Build scalable analytic solutions using state of the art tools of Criteo analytics stack (Hadoop, Vertica, PySpark‚Ä¶)
Develop innovative analytical approaches to measure Brands & Retailers‚Äô performance from design to presentation of results, leveraging all our expertise in Data Science (statistical thinking, A/B testing, bootstrapping, data visualization‚Ä¶)
Frequently interact with other teams (R&D, product, commercial teams‚Ä¶) and clients to share data-driven recommendations and insights
Develop and maintain deep knowledge of Criteo Retail Media products and technologies as they evolve



Who You Are:

You are passionate about data and want to work with leading edge technologies in online industry:


You have at least 2 years‚Äô experience in Data Science or Data Analytics
Master‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, etc.)
Fluency in the core toolkit of Data Science/Data Analytics: SQL is required, Python is a real asset (master most common data libraries: pandas, numpy‚Ä¶)
Outstanding analytical skills: passion for translating data-speak into relevant, compelling stories
A background in the digital industry or consulting is a plus
You have the combination of technical skills, passion for learning, and the soft skills to work with all personality types in a dynamic environment
You are fluent in English



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Strategy Analyst
Description:
Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing societal impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible.

We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! üìöYour work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide.







About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst that will help us continue enhancing the usage of data for the fact-based decision making processes that Clarity AI has as one of their core values and lead the lifecycle of transforming raw data into structured information üöÄ

The role provides an opportunity to join a dynamic, talented, diverse and young company, as well as be part of the team that leads Data acquisition‚Ä¶one of the foundations of Clarity AI value proposition ü™¥




What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Working as a Data Analyst you will be responsible for:

Gather data from primary and secondary sources, ensuring the upkeep of databases and data systems
Cleanse data and scrutinize reports and outputs to identify and rectify errors
Developing and maintaining data dashboards, charts used to support critical business monitoring
Performing ad-hoc complex data analysis using SQL and Python to support business initiatives
Conveying insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations
Collaborating with key stakeholders from the team to determine and rank the needs around forecasting and budget, as well as data collection monitoring and data sources usage
Collaborating with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done and understand data analysis requirements
Influencing key stakeholders through data analysis to establish a strong sense of collaboration towards a shared vision and goals.
Identify opportunities for process enhancements




Location

The role is based in Madrid or Barcelona üåç

Way of Working: Hybrid




What You‚Äôll Need

Mastery in data analysis languages as excel, SQL, Python skills and/or R
Demonstrated experience working with BI Tools (Tableau, Quicksight, PowerBI etc)
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact.
Years of Experience: At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Educational Background: Degree in Business, Engineering or a quantitative discipline
Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative
Decisive and action-oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when they are short of information, and someone who has high energy and stamina
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)







Nice To Have

Experience in a start-up and/or tech company
Business oriented person, with deep attention to details
Adept at report writing and presenting findings
Additional hands-on technical experience an asset (GitHub, APIs, DBT, web-scraping)
A deep understanding of the industry and business operations is a plus




Benefits

Equity Plans - ESOP / Phantom Stock: share our success!
Annual training budget to support your professional growth
Private healthcare cover
Wellness and Fitness cover with Gympass!
Flexible Work Arrangements; We promote work-life balance through flexible schedules and remote work options
Global offices across New York, Madrid, Barcelona, London, Paris, and Abu Dhabi, and access to a global network of co-working spaces




More About Clarity AI ‚≠ê

Clarity AI‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognised by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum as one of the most distinguished leaders under 40.

Clarity AI has received several awards:

The Forrester New Wave - ESG Ratings, Data, and Analytics - Leaders for 2022-2023-2024
Investment Week - Best Sustainable Investment Research & Ratings Provider 2023
Fast Company - Most Innovative Companies 2023
European Commission | EU Seal of Excellence 2020
World Economic Forum - Technology Pioneer 2020
World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader - Rebeca Minguela




Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.

Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
About Our Company

Schneider Electric is the global specialist in energy management and automation. With revenues of ~‚Ç¨25 billion in FY2016, our 144,000+ employees serve customers in over 100 countries, helping them to manage their energy and process in ways that are safe, reliable, efficient and sustainable. From the simplest of switches to complex operational systems, our technology, software and services improve the way our customers manage and automate their operations. Our connected technologies reshape industries, transform cities and enrich lives.

At Schneider Electric, we call this Life Is On.

Who we are?

We are the Data Quality Team, part of the Data and Performance organization. We are leading the effort to improve the maturity of Data at its foundations. We are implementing new approaches, processes and roles to increase overall SE data quality, which means that Data is fit for purpose. quality of data is measured in a safe and cost-effective manner and it is sustainably maintained in its integrity and quality.‚ÄØ

The Data Quality team aim is to deploy across the organization a data quality process which is defined in its key steps as discovery, data profiling, identification of Critical Data Elements and definition of data quality check to assess their status, implementation of the quality control and of reporting based on their results, and issue management.

Major duties and responsibilities

As a Data Quality analyst, you will:


Gathers and structures information about DQ check from various sources
Manage the DQ check portfolio and facilitate its reusability across the data community
Collects and interprets data related to DQ issue management


As Part of the overall Data Quality Team:


Support the Data Quality process deployment as a service, within‚ÄØthe agile development teams, building global re-usable data objects in order to facilitate the completion of the data quality deliverables
Participate in the definition and verification of best practices in the implementation of DQ Checks
Support Data Consumers and technical expert in the execution of DQ Issue Management and collects and interprets data


Qualifications


Engineering Graduate or Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
Experience 5 - 10 years with Quality process or Data management
Experience in reporting packages and in analyzing large datasets
Ability to write comprehensive report
Hands on experience on SQL
Knowledge of architecture and operating models design
Preferred some experience on data catoluging ,AWS, Informatica Cloud and BI tools (tableau).
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Travel up to 15% of time (in normal circumstances)
English fluency


What's in it for me?


Life insurance.
Health insurance
Flexible compensation: ticket restaurant , nursery, training, pension plan etc.
Own your career: Enjoy all the benefits of Open Talent Market, our platform that uses AI to connect you with hundreds of job opportunities, projects and mentors around the world.
Flex@Work: flexible hours, telework, sabbaticals, purchase leave, floating holidays, Global Family Leave Policy.
Recognize and be recognized through our StepUp program.
Club Schneider: discount on products and services throughout Spain.
Wellness: medical service, wellbeing laboratories, activities per workplace, gyms in different sites, etc.
If you like to go to the gym, we have a special agreement with Andjoy Become a Schneider shareholder with our "WESOP" program.
Many more benefits per site ... !


Let us learn about you! Apply today.

DIGDATA24

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Why us?

At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a meaningful purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.

We believe in empowering our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.

We embrace inclusion as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.

If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.

Discover your Meaningful, Inclusive and Empowered career at Schneider Electric.

‚Ç¨34.2bn global revenue

+12% organic growth

135 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World‚Äôs most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best.

We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we ‚Äòembrace different‚Äô as one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Data Analyst - Global Partner Ops Product and Excellence (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

Your Work-life Opportunity

You will join a dynamic and fast-growing operations team. The Partner Ops Product and Excellence department are responsible for ensuring excellence in the performance of the hundreds of thousands of partners that collaborate each day with Glovo. You will be directly responsible for improving the Partners‚Äô experience across their whole journey, making them grow and improve user UX, from the data perspective. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, results-oriented, analytical, and passionate about innovation and entrepreneurship. The role would mean not only providing data and insights to guide the team to make the right decisions but also owning full projects related to the Partners. Ownership and responsibilities will be given to you from day one. Be a part of a team where you will:


Create and manage core data products that are used to execute impact analysis to evaluate our project performance.
Improve current data sources & reporting to make faster decisions.
Ensure data pipelines and development processes operational and efficient.
Work on strategic analysis that will help to detect further opportunities
Understand, deep-dive and have a complete awareness of Glovo‚Äôs partner operations situation at all times. Develop analytical frameworks, analyses, dashboards and models for the whole organization.
Raise product requests to improve partners' UX and scalability. Identify tech feature improvements and give proactive feedback to the Product team.
Execute end-to-end projects at a global level


You Have


1/2 years of experience providing business teams with data for decision-making
Analytical skills: breaking big problems into smaller ones and problem-solving skills, with adaptability to change, is a must
Experience developing in Python and writing complex SQL queries is a must
Experience with reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau, and Google Data Studio is a must
Experience with data engineering-related tools (Airflow, Github, etc) is a plus.
Good communication skills in English (plus Spanish as a bonus)
Great team player and organizational skills
Experience in managing projects is a plus
International studies or experience is a plus


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Place: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
Description:

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
SegurCaixa Adeslas es la compa√±√≠a No Vida l√≠der en Espa√±a en seguros de salud, con una cuota de mercado en torno al 30%. Integrada en el Grupo Mutua Madrile√±a y participada por CaixaBank, la aseguradora ocupa tambi√©n una posici√≥n relevante en otros ramos principales como Hogar, Accidentes o Decesos.




En los √∫ltimos a√±os se ha convertido en una entidad de referencia gracias a la implantaci√≥n de un modelo de negocio basado en el crecimiento sostenido y rentable, que sit√∫a al cliente en el centro de la estrategia. A trav√©s de su acuerdo de bancaseguros con CaixaBank, SegurCaixa Adeslas comercializa sus productos en la mayor red bancaria de Espa√±a. Adicionalmente, la aseguradora cuenta con una red tradicional con m√°s de 4.000 puntos de venta y atenci√≥n al cliente.




Estamos convencid@s de que las personas son el principal valor de nuestra compa√±√≠a y por eso SegurCaixa Adeslas se muestra absolutamente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad persigue hacer efectivo este principio y por ello, el proceso de selecci√≥n de nuestras ofertas garantiza la igualdad de oportunidades a todas las candidaturas.




Seleccionamos para incorporar en Barcelona a un/a Senior Data Analyst para el Dpto. de Planificaci√≥n y Gesti√≥n de la Informaci√≥n.

Las funciones a realizar ser√°n las siguientes:




Elaborar seguimientos comerciales sobre las campa√±as desarrolladas por Marketing.
Anticiparse a las necesidades de la Direcci√≥n General de Negocio en la definici√≥n, mantenimiento y creaci√≥n de informes de seguimiento comercial.
Revisar y garantizar la fiabilidad de los datos que se muestran en los seguimientos, as√≠ como su distribuci√≥n en plazo.
Realizar mejoras en los informes de seguimiento actuales e implementar automatizaciones que permitan ahorrar tiempo para desarrollar nuevas tareas.
Realizar presentaciones ah-hoc para la Direcci√≥n y la red comercial.
Buscar nuevas fuentes de datos para la realizaci√≥n de nuevos informes de seguimiento.
Auditar las fuentes origen de informaci√≥n a fin de mantener la fiabilidad de los datos.
Interacci√≥n con el √°rea de sistemas para llevar a cabo el desarrollo de requerimientos, revisi√≥n de funcionales y validaci√≥n de pruebas de las peticiones realizadas por Negocio.




Requisitos:




Formaci√≥n: Titulaci√≥n universitaria (Matem√°ticas/Ingenier√≠a/Inform√°tica/ADE o Econom√≠a o similares).
Experiencia: 8-10 a√±os desarrollando funciones similares en empresas del sector asegurador y/o consultor√≠a.
Inform√°tica y aplicaciones: Programaci√≥n en SQL y VBA, Business Objects y nivel experto en Ms Office (Access, Excel, PowerPoint).
Experiencia en la gesti√≥n de bases de datos y en la coordinaci√≥n de proyectos.




Ofrecemos:

Contrato indefinido y flexibilidad de horarios
Desarrollo profesional dentro de empresa l√≠der en el sector
Interesantes beneficios sociales

Title: HR Data Analyst (100% remote-friendly within Spain/Poland)
HTML:
Welcome to the good side of tech üëã

You might have heard about us, but with a different name: Doctoralia. It all started 10 years ago, when we asked ourselves: is anyone in healthcare thinking about patients? We jumped in and we empowered patients by giving them access to leave and read reviews about their visit. We then provided doctors with the technology to manage bookings easily and save time, so they could devote themselves to what they always wanted: treating patients. And today is the day in which we ask you: will you join us in the next step of making the healthcare experience more human?

Docplanner at scale

We are leaders in 13 countries so far, and more than 90 million patients trust us every month. Almost 300.000 specialists believe in us and our product, and so do leading venture capital funds such as Point Nine Capital, Goldman Sachs Asset Management and One Peak Partners. And yet, employing over 2.700 people all over the globe, we managed to keep the startup-mindset we started with over 10 years ago.

Job Description

Our primary objective is to assist business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing global reports as the primary and most reliable source of information. A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

How would you be impacting our mission?

  • Derive facts from data and translate them into actionable insights and recommendations;
  • Support the People Experience (HR) team with identifying opportunities and making intelligent, data-driven decisions. You will execute end-to-end data projects and be the main point of contact for the internal stakeholders;
  • Leverage reporting, data analytics, data quality and visualization to provide insights for routine and ad-hoc operational requests;
  • Co-creating key definitions of KPIs, and ensuring their global alignment.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?

  • Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights;
  • Have 2+ years of experience in the business/ data/ HR analysis area;
  • Experience in working with business oriented teams, knowing how to adjust their way of explanation to the audience;
  • Experience in data management and visualization (experience in Tableau is a plus);
  • Experience in conducting quantitative and qualitative research; can work with multiple sources of data;
  • Experience in leading and executing end-to-end Data projects;
  • Strong presentation skills, with the ability to influence and engage diverse audiences;
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English.

Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?

  • Have a degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field;
  • Experience in working in an international team;
  • Can take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens;
  • Like to see the instant effects of your work;
  • Are careful, diligent, and detail-oriented.


Additional Information

What will you get in return?

Let‚Äôs talk money

  • Flexible remuneration and benefits system via Flexoh, which includes: restaurant card, transportation card, kindergarten, and training tax savings;
  • Share options plan after 6 months of working with us.

True flexibility and work-life balance

  • Remote first in one of our legal entities or hybrid work model in one of our office locations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Paid time off according to your location of work;
  • Additional paid holiday on your birthday or work anniversary (you choose what you want to celebrate).

Health comes first

  • Health insurance according to your location of work;
  • Access to iFeel, a technological platform for mental wellness offering online psychological support and counseling.

What does the recruitment process look like?

  • A 30-minute Screening Call with one of our Talent Acquisition Partners: Lilly Kilian or Anna Reinhardt;
  • Meet our CPO Lucjan Samulowski within two separate 60-minute meetings.
  • A 60-minute technical interview with Wiktor Kulikowski - BI Manager
  • A 60-minute business case review with Lucjan and Wiktor

We promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. When you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. If you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. Behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. So, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve as a sign that, now, you can do so. We can only truly be equal if we adapt to each other.

‚ÄúWe believe all humans, in all their beautiful diversity, should have equal rights, dignity and respect. Period.‚Äù Mariusz Gralewski, CEO

Title: Customer Service Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We are now looking for a technical Business Analyst for Customer Support. The Customer Support area has been transformative during the pandemic. During the last year it has been transformed from a supporting department to a key differentiator against the competition. We have developed some features that revolutionized the way people manage their bookings and made travelling more flexible from a consumer point of view.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

20 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 5.4M members in Prime

16.2 million bookings FY23 - More than 50,000 bookings per day - 100 million daily user searches

1400 employees ‚Äì More than 50 different nationalities - 99% permanent contracts - 36.3 average age

We're a leading travel tech company, revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Customer Service Data Analyst you will be in charge of:


Responsible for execution of key analysis, being the data entry point for the business team and including taking ownership of the different data sources from the business side. Understand the business needs, gather the data and present the key insights: ‚ÄúContribute to the Customer Support strategic roadmap with numbers‚Äù
Analyze Data from the whole area, we serve both the Product area as well as all our centers. This means you‚Äôll be answering questions like how can we best utilize our VIP agents as well as going into depth about how we can improve our chatbot
Elaborate business cases to support strategic product decisions: e.g. should we train more agents? what is the next feature we should develop? should we double down on our efforts and redirect more customers to the chat bot ?
Create dashboards and tracking: master the internal Business Intelligence tools to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs. Work with data engineering and data science teams to be able to leverage all our internal data
Contribute to the delivery of Customer Service strategic projects: participate in the delivery of the key internal projects, giving support from the business side to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with product and call centers in the execution of the projects, giving support from the analytical and business side



What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),
2-4 years experience in a role with strong analytical component
Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data; python programming skills and experience with Google DataStudio will be highly valued
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)
Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivity
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!
Business Proficiency in English



What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

  • Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc)
  • Strong analytical skills, fast-learner, with high attention to detail and focused on results and productivity
  • A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun!
  • Business Proficiency in English


What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:

  • A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
  • Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
  • Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
  • Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
  • Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
  • Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.


Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Services Data analyst and engineering
Description:
Job Summary


This role is responsible for data collection procedures, including accurate and relevant data for machine learning models, extracting and analyzing data from the primary and secondary database. The role ensures data integrity and compliance by performing data cleansing and data validations. The role performs root-cause analysis and recommends or executes corrective actions when data related system problems occur. The role applies developed subject matter knowledge to solve common and complex business issues within established guidelines and recommends appropriate alternatives.


Responsibilities


Designs and establishes secure and performant data architectures, enhancements, updates, and programming changes for portions and subsystems of data pipelines, repositories or models for structured/unstructured data.
Analyzes design and determines coding, programming, and integration activities required based on general objectives and knowledge of overall architecture of product or solution.
Writes and executes complete testing plans, protocols, and documentation for assigned portion of data system or component; identifies and debugs, and creates solutions for issues with code and integration into data system architecture.
Leads a project team of other data engineers to develop reliable, cost effective and high-quality solutions for assigned data system, model, or component.
Collaborates and communicates with project team regarding project progress and issue resolution.
Analyzes data inaccuracies, identifies opportunities and supports the development of automated solutions to enhance overall quality of the enterprise data.
Identifies problematic areas and conducts research to determine the best course of action to correct the data; identifies, analyzes and interprets trends and patterns in complex datasets.
Works cross-functionally with different departments to assess, define, and develop report deliverables.
Represents the software data engineering team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects.
Provides guidance and mentoring to less experienced staff members.


Education & Experience Recommended


Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, Statistics/ Mathematics, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence.
Typically has 4-7 years of work experience, preferably in data analytics, data engineering, data modeling, or a related field or an advanced degree with 3-5 years of work experience.


Preferred Certifications


Programming Language/s Certification (SQL, Python, or similar)


Knowledge & Skills


Agile Methodology
Amazon Web Services
Apache Hadoop
Apache Kafka
Apache Spark
Big Data
Computer Science
Data Analysis
Data Engineering
Data Modeling
Data Pipelines
Data Warehousing
Extract Transform Load (ETL)
Java (Programming Language)
Machine Learning
Microsoft Azure
Python (Programming Language)
Scala (Programming Language)
Scalability
SQL (Programming Language)


Cross-Org Skills


Effective Communication
Results Orientation
Learning Agility
Digital Fluency
Customer Centricity


Impact & Scope


Impacts multiple teams and may act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process.


Complexity


Responds to moderately complex issues within established guidelines.


Disclaimer


This job description describes the general nature and level of work performed in this role. It is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, skills, responsibilities, knowledge, etc. These may be subject to change and additional functions may be assigned as needed by management.

Title: Data Analyst - Account Management Operations (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

In this role you will be part of the Account Management Team at Glovo Headquarters, that is focused on growing and retaining Glovo partners. You will be directly responsible for overseeing, challenging and rethinking the processes, data & tools of the post-sales operational landscape, based on solid data driven conclusions, so that they can be implemented on a global scale.

THE JOURNEY


Stakeholder management: Partner closely with senior sales leaders and cross functional partners to align on strategy
Communication: find simple ways to convey insights and recommendations from sophisticated analysis results to business leaders.
Data Analysis: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to interpret complex datasets; Analyze and report weekly and monthly metrics to identify trends and stop opportunities for improvement.
Process Optimization: leverage critical thinking skills to analyze Account Management processes and lead the implementation of optimization strategies to drive efficiency and effectiveness in sales operations.
Automation: Design and implement automation solutions to remove manual processes.
Planning: Partner with Account Management leadership to set performance targets for local teams, recommend actions for improvement and work together to integrate positive changes within the operational environment.
Forecast: provide analytical and operational support to continuously improve our forecasting, pipeline management, and methodologies and processes.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Bachelor or equivalent in Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Accounting
4+ years of work experience with 2+ years in Sales Operations, preferably in a fast-growing B2B environment.
Technical and Proficient in data. Analyzing data sets with SQL queries, or crafting models and prototype tools, data is a core part of your toolkit.
Experience with BI tools and data visualization like Tableau, Power BI or Looker.
Experience with Salesforce.
Experience in complex problem solving, and working in a fast paced environment.
Demonstrated ability in critical thinking and process optimization, with a proven track of identifying inefficiencies and implementing solutions to enhance business operations.
Verbal and written communication skills. Strong consensus building and executive presence to communicate and defend plans.


Nice to have


Experience with Python or R is a strong plus.
Experience with forecasting and target setting, using data to establish future goals.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Technical Analyst - BI Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

WELCOME TO SITA

We're the team that keeps airports moving, airlines flying smoothly, and borders open. Our tech and communication innovations are the secret behind the success of the world‚Äôs air travel industry.

You'll find us at 95% of international hubs. We partner closely with over 2,500 transportation and government clients, each with their own unique needs and challenges. Our goal is to find fresh solutions and cutting-edge tech to make their operations run like clockwork. Want to be a part of something big?

Are you ready to love your job? The adventure begins right here, with you, at SITA.

About The Role & Team

Our team is in search of a BI Data Analyst with experience in an operational role, focusing on building and maintaining high-quality data sets. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data quality and controls, with a proven track record of enhancing data-driven decision-making processes. As a BI Data Analyst, you will be responsible for maintaining the transforming raw data into meaningful insights and ensuring the integrity and accuracy of our data infrastructure.

What You‚Äôll Do


Develop Power BI Reports: Create comprehensive and interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI, utilizing data to deliver quality data sets that enable actionable insights to business stakeholders.
Ensure Data Quality: Monitor data sets, employing advanced data validation and cleansing techniques to maintain high standards of data integrity and quality.
Data Integration and Transformation: Monitor and build integration and transformation from various sources, preparing it for in-depth analysis and visualization in Power BI.
Optimize Power BI Performance: Tune Power BI data sets and dashboards for optimal performance, ensuring efficient data refreshes and query execution against data sources.
Documentation and Compliance: Maintain accurate and comprehensive documentation of data models, ETL processes, and reporting frameworks within PostgreSQL and Power BI environments, adhering to data governance and privacy standards.



Qualifications

ABOUT YOUR SKILLS


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology or Data Science with a strong emphasis on analytics.
At least 4 years working experience in a BI/Data Analyst role, with a focus on data quality and controls, particularly using Power BI for reporting and analytics.
Certification in Power BI or equivalent professional training
Proficiency in managing relational databases with a good understanding of its advanced features like support for various data types (numbers, text, JSON, XML, arrays), ensuring data integrity, and leveraging SQL for database access and manipulation.
Knowledge of agile methodology principles
Clear communication skills, capable of mentoring and guiding teams with a focus on financial analytics.
You are assertive, highly motivated, with the ability to influence outcomes, drive issues to closure, and pursue challenging goals vigorously.
You possess good communication skills, capable of engaging in various forms of discussions.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
You exhibit proficient data management and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.



NICE-TO-HAVE


Using Azure DevOps for project management and collaboration.



What We Offer

We‚Äôre all about diversity. We operate in 200 countries and speak 60 different languages and cultures. We‚Äôre really proud of our inclusive environment. Our offices are comfortable and fun places to work, and we make sure you get to work from home too. Find out what it's like to join our team and take a step closer to your best life ever.

üè° Flex Week: Work from home up to 2 days/week (depending on your team‚Äôs needs)

‚è∞ Flex Day: Make your workday suit your life and plans.

üåé Flex Location: Take up to 30 days a year to work from any location in the world.

üåøEmployee Wellbeing: We‚Äôve got you covered with our Employee Assistance Program (EAP), for you and your dependents 24/7, 365 days/year. We also offer Champion Health - a personalized platform that supports a range of wellbeing needs.

üöÄProfessional Development: Level up your skills with our training platforms, including LinkedIn Learning!

üôåüèΩ Competitive Benefits: Competitive benefits that make sense with both your local market and employment status.

SITA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, we encourage women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities to apply and self-identify in the application process.

  • Proficiency in managing relational databases with a good understanding of its advanced features like support for various data types (numbers, text, JSON, XML, arrays), ensuring data integrity, and leveraging SQL for database access and manipulation.
  • Knowledge of agile methodology principles
  • Clear communication skills, capable of mentoring and guiding teams with a focus on financial analytics.
  • You are assertive, highly motivated, with the ability to influence outcomes, drive issues to closure, and pursue challenging goals vigorously.
  • You possess good communication skills, capable of engaging in various forms of discussions.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • You exhibit proficient data management and analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.


NICE-TO-HAVE

  • Using Azure DevOps for project management and collaboration.


What We Offer

We‚Äôre all about diversity. We operate in 200 countries and speak 60 different languages and cultures. We‚Äôre really proud of our inclusive environment. Our offices are comfortable and fun places to work, and we make sure you get to work from home too. Find out what it's like to join our team and take a step closer to your best life ever.

üè° Flex Week: Work from home up to 2 days/week (depending on your team‚Äôs needs)

‚è∞ Flex Day: Make your workday suit your life and plans.

üåé Flex Location: Take up to 30 days a year to work from any location in the world.

üåøEmployee Wellbeing: We‚Äôve got you covered with our Employee Assistance Program (EAP), for you and your dependents 24/7, 365 days/year. We also offer Champion Health - a personalized platform that supports a range of wellbeing needs.

üöÄProfessional Development: Level up your skills with our training platforms, including LinkedIn Learning!

üôåüèΩ Competitive Benefits: Competitive benefits that make sense with both your local market and employment status.

SITA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, we encourage women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities to apply and self-identify in the application process.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Mission:

At Schneider Electric, you will contribute to solving the climate crisis and accelerating the energy transformation that our planet urgently needs. You will work among colleagues with very diverse personal and professional experiences, united by a vision of a better world.

Location & commitments:


Full-time job
Warsaw, Poland (office in Konstruktorska street)
Hybrid job (2 days remotely)
Your manager: Micha≈Ç Sirak


Your IMPACT:


Research and identify data and analytical business needs and determine possible solutions
Conduct data discovery, profiling, analyze data lineage and determine schema
Automate data sets extractions and transformations for analytical or reporting consumption
Scale-up, productionize, and maintain developed automations
Design, build and operate robust and scalable dashboards and visualizations
Perform light statistical analysis and machine learning
Listen to stakeholders and develop a deep understanding of their needs and priorities
Tenaciously solve problems and make decisions under uncertainty
Actively contribute to scrum ceremonies including sprint planning, daily stand-up, sprint review and retrospectives


Your Profile:


University degree in: Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics or equivalent
Hands-on experience with Python, databases and SQL
Hands-on experience designing, building, and operating dashboards and visualizations in Tableau or equivalent
Effectively communicating complex topics with non-technical users
Experience in applying statistical analysis
Passionate about learning every day and transferring knowledge
Good command of English


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with AWS
Experience with Databricks (or cloud-based data warehouse)
Experience with PySpark


Our Offer:


EXCITING JOB in an international company, which is leading the Digital Transformation of Energy Management and Automation, with significant market share,
DEVELOPMENT - the opportunity to gain valuable work experience in a supportive team of professionals,
ONBOARDING TRANINGS to help you find your way in our company,
WIDE CHOICE OF BENEFITS - private medical care, life insurance, sports card, performance bonus, benefits cafeteria with the possibility to exchange points for selected products or services,
BENEFITS FOR EMPLOYEES‚Äô CHILDREN from the company's social fund,
ADDITIONAL FAMILY LEAVE - for the birth of a child or adoption, to care for a family member or for bereavement (additional leave beyond the terms of labor law),
PROJECT WORK OPPORTUNITY (e.g., ambassador programme, mentoring, digitisation projects),
DIVERSE TEAM - working in a diverse team and the opportunity to use foreign languages in your daily work,
ACCESS TO TRAINING PLATFORM - training tailored to your needs and career goals,
RECOGNITION - points that can be exchanged for various products and services,
PARTICIPATION IN CSR or SUSTAINABILITY PROJECTS - 1 fully paid volunteer day per year,
EMPLOYEE REFERRAL PROGRAM - have a say in who you work with and get an attractive financial bonus,
NO FORMAL DRESS CODE - we welcome people as they are and see diversity as a value to the company.


Curiosity, Inclusion, Teamwork:

Nobody is flawless and not all career paths are the same. The important thing is that we have the will to learn and develop ourselves further. Because we know that career also means having to find your strengths first. Apply now, even if you don't fulfil all the requirements (yet). We look forward to getting to know you!

‚ÄØ

Your next step? Now apply online!

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

‚Ç¨36 billion global revenue

+13% organic growth

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World‚Äôs most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‚Äòinclusion‚Äô is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. You can find out more about our Trust Charter here

Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.

Title: Data Analyst Intern, Emerging, EMEA
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Performance Media Analytics team, you won't just analyse data; you'll be the cornerstone that connects groundbreaking ideas with real-world business applications. Here, your expertise will not only shape solutions but also empower our clients and commercial teams to make impactful decisions:


Client insights: you will analyze complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership teams
Tech Playground: Immerse yourself in an environment where experimenting with advanced analytics tools isn't just encouraged, it's part of your daily work.
Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company.



Your Work Environment:


Flexible remote working options - balance your life the way you want.
A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.
Need special work hours? Let's talk about it!



Who You Are:


A problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Interested in solving data problems using Python & SQL, and enthusiastic about automating and scaling solutions.
Business-minded with a goal to turn data insights into actionable strategies.
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Data Analyst II (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Join our team and become an integral part of Glovo's Global Operations! We provide a dynamic and challenging environment filled with numerous opportunities for growth and development.

Couriers are the cornerstone of Glovo‚Äôs marketplace. We are seeking a Data Analyst who can strike the perfect balance between creativity and data-driven precision, turning seemingly impossible projects into reality.

In this role, you will be responsible for delivering insights and data to drive the core strategies of the Courier Supply Excellence team. By leveraging analytics, you will globally identify methods to enhance courier engagement at the order, hourly, and monthly levels. The KPIs you will influence are crucial to operations, as every decision made will directly affect the whole operational investment.

THE JOURNEY


Bring your boldest ideas to life and make an immediate global impact.
Understand and address local and regional needs by stepping into the shoes of the couriers and truly understanding their perspective.
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs operations.
Offer analytical support to teams across more than 20 countries by deepening the understanding of Glovo's operational model.
Enhance the strategies we use to define each market‚Äôs approach.
Manage dashboards and create new tools to improve the department‚Äôs metric visibility.
Develop analytical frameworks and models, while effectively communicating with the entire department.
Dive deep into data to identify key factors and actions to improve KPIs, taking accountability for outcomes.
Innovate to contribute to the ongoing improvement of courier profitability.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics or similar
+2 years of work experience providing internal teams with the necessary data to make the right decisions, banking / financial background is a plus
Strong analytical and coding skills: SQL and Excel proficiency (or extensive coding experience), and BI platforms experience (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI,‚Ä¶)
Python and experience working with analysis tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Scikit, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R is highly valued
Strong strategic vision and business mindset
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Comfortable working in high-growth and high-performance start-ups with a fast-paced
Professional English


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, International client.|Power BI, SQL, DAX.


About Our Client

Leading global supplier of technology and services.

Job Description


Maintenance, design, and development of reports in Power BI to provide key information to the business teams.
Maintenance and development of Power Automate flows to optimize internal processes.
Develop and optimize data models to ensure the accuracy and quality of information.
Coordination with the data engineering team to ensure data accuracy and quality.
Work with business teams to understand their reporting and analysis needs and provide effective solutions.
Provide training and support to Power BI users in the company to ensure their proper utilization.


The Successful Applicant


Demonstrable experience as a data analyst with a focus on Power BI, with solid knowledge of DAX, data modeling, and dashboard visualization and design.
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases for efficient data management.
Strong data analysis skills to interpret and effectively communicate results.
Collaborative ability to work in a team, share knowledge, and contribute to achieving common goals.
Autonomy and problem-solving skills to take charge of issues and provide effective solutions.
Education in Engineering, Mathematics, Business Administration/Economics, or related fields.
Fluent in Spanish, fluency in English will be a big plus.
Candidates must be based in Barcelona or Vigo (Pontevedra).


What's on Offer


Career progression
Learning
International environment
Work flexibility


Contact: Impacto PositivoPG_impacto_positivo_logo.pngJordi Aluma

Quote job ref: JN-082024-6498671
