Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us




We are a multinational food company that conserves the goodness of nature in our products. We carefully select our fruit and vegetables from their origin, maintaining the highest quality and safety throughout the production process.




We pride ourselves in providing consumers with natural, healthy, and nutritious products that have made us a reference in infant and adult nutrition. In addition, the Hero Institute of Infant Nutrition is within the Hero Spain facilities.




Website: www.hero.es




Sector: Food company




Company size: More than 4,000 employees




Headquarters: Lenzburg, Switzerland




Company type: Private company




Categories: Baby food, Healthy Snacks, Natural Spreads, Sauces, Juices and Nectars, Cereal Snacks, Prepared meals




What is our commitment?




We are on a mission to delight consumers by conserving the goodness of nature. The world today is different from what it was 10 years ago, and nothing like it was in 1886 when Hero was founded in Lenzburg, Switzerland. However, our core goals remain the same. We have adapted to change, offering consumers high quality, healthy, natural and sustainable food.




Hero Spain, with its headquarter in Alcantarilla (Murcia), has formed part of this legacy since 1922. We are committed to naturalness in our products, maintaining a firm nutritional commitment and constantly improving thanks to our commitment to continuous innovation and research, to adapt to the needs of consumers, customers, and new market trends.




Team value proposition




Recently, Hero Spain has been certified as a #TopEmployer in 2023 and 2024 üèÜ, an achievement that reflects our ongoing commitment to the well-being and development of our team of talents. This recognition is a testament to the exceptional culture we have cultivated together, positioning us as one of the best companies to work for in Spain. This would not have been possible without the commitment and dedication of every person who is part of the Hero family.




We don't hire top talent so we can tell them what to do. That doesn't make sense. At Hero, we give you the opportunity to make your mark and contribute to something bigger. We‚Äôll give you the tools and skills to do your job and then get out of the way.




Purpose




We are on a mission to conserve what's good in nature. We do so by striving to conduct our business sustainably and striving to do the right thing. Always. Without compromises.




Values

The new values reflect the company today and the company we want to build in the future. Values are at the heart of who we are as people and they guide how we behave.




Create wow

We dare to do things differently, seek to always win with consumers and customers, and endeavor to be forever relevant and vital to our world. It‚Äôs about Curiosity, Innovation and Consumer/Customer Focus.

Everyone Hero

We work together in pursuit of our common mission and strategy, strengthening our local businesses by leveraging the power of the collective. It‚Äôs about Purpose, Performance and Teamwork.

Nourish others

We treat everyone with honesty, care and respect and provide our people, customers and consumers with what they need to thrive. It‚Äôs about Honesty, Empowerment, Respect and Diversity.

Take responsibility

We make good choices today to build a more sustainable business and environment fit for the needs of tomorrow. It‚Äôs about Sustainability, Ownership, Heritage and Quality.




Impact




We value good ideas, so we want the best talent. Our people can make a difference because we give them the freedom to act, to be entrepreneurial, and to make a difference. This is reflected in the responsibilities. Be yourself, be impactful.




Growth




We all win if we grow together. It's about professional and personal growth. The best way to grow as a company is to help you grow as a person, hence the availability of learning and development opportunities.




Meet you future department




The Finance department owns the financial close process and produces financial statements and reports to guide strategic decision-making.




How can you help us?




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights and generate ideas that drive strategic decision-making within the company. Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.




Your main responsibilities




Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, including internal databases, SAP systems, and other relevant data sources.
Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to different departments.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement through data analysis.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.




Academic Background




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a business environment.
Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, with particular value placed on Power BI.

(Confidentiality is assured)

HTML:
About us


We are a multinational food company that conserves the goodness of nature in our products. We carefully select our fruit and vegetables from their origin, maintaining the highest quality and safety throughout the production process.


We pride ourselves in providing consumers with natural, healthy, and nutritious products that have made us a reference in infant and adult nutrition. In addition, the Hero Institute of Infant Nutrition is within the Hero Spain facilities.


Website: www.hero.es


Sector: Food company


Company size: More than 4,000 employees


Headquarters: Lenzburg, Switzerland


Company type: Private company


Categories: Baby food, Healthy Snacks, Natural Spreads, Sauces, Juices and Nectars, Cereal Snacks, Prepared meals


What is our commitment?


We are on a mission to delight consumers by conserving the goodness of nature. The world today is different from what it was 10 years ago, and nothing like it was in 1886 when Hero was founded in Lenzburg, Switzerland. However, our core goals remain the same. We have adapted to change, offering consumers high quality, healthy, natural and sustainable food.


Hero Spain, with its headquarter in Alcantarilla (Murcia), has formed part of this legacy since 1922. We are committed to naturalness in our products, maintaining a firm nutritional commitment and constantly improving thanks to our commitment to continuous innovation and research, to adapt to the needs of consumers, customers, and new market trends.


Team value proposition


Recently, Hero Spain has been certified as a #TopEmployer in 2023 and 2024 üèÜ, an achievement that reflects our ongoing commitment to the well-being and development of our team of talents. This recognition is a testament to the exceptional culture we have cultivated together, positioning us as one of the best companies to work for in Spain. This would not have been possible without the commitment and dedication of every person who is part of the Hero family.


We don't hire top talent so we can tell them what to do. That doesn't make sense. At Hero, we give you the opportunity to make your mark and contribute to something bigger. We‚Äôll give you the tools and skills to do your job and then get out of the way.


Purpose


We are on a mission to conserve what's good in nature. We do so by striving to conduct our business sustainably and striving to do the right thing. Always. Without compromises.


Values

The new values reflect the company today and the company we want to build in the future. Values are at the heart of who we are as people and they guide how we behave.


Create wow

We dare to do things differently, seek to always win with consumers and customers, and endeavor to be forever relevant and vital to our world. It‚Äôs about Curiosity, Innovation and Consumer/Customer Focus.

Everyone Hero

We work together in pursuit of our common mission and strategy, strengthening our local businesses by leveraging the power of the collective. It‚Äôs about Purpose, Performance and Teamwork.

Nourish others

We treat everyone with honesty, care and respect and provide our people, customers and consumers with what they need to thrive. It‚Äôs about Honesty, Empowerment, Respect and Diversity.

Take responsibility

We make good choices today to build a more sustainable business and environment fit for the needs of tomorrow. It‚Äôs about Sustainability, Ownership, Heritage and Quality.


Impact


We value good ideas, so we want the best talent. Our people can make a difference because we give them the freedom to act, to be entrepreneurial, and to make a difference. This is reflected in the responsibilities. Be yourself, be impactful.


Growth


We all win if we grow together. It's about professional and personal growth. The best way to grow as a company is to help you grow as a person, hence the availability of learning and development opportunities.


Meet you future department


The Finance department owns the financial close process and produces financial statements and reports to guide strategic decision-making.


How can you help us?


As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights and generate ideas that drive strategic decision-making within the company. Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.


Your main responsibilities


  • Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, including internal databases, SAP systems, and other relevant data sources.
  • Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to different departments.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement through data analysis.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
  • Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
  • Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
  • Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.


Academic Background


  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
  • Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.
  • Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a business environment.
  • Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, with particular value placed on Power BI.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Platform, Databases, DAX.


Skills and competences


  • Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into meaningful information, as well as representing it in graphical and visual reports.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
  • Results-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.


Others


  • Based in Spain


What do we offer you?


(Confidentiality is assured)

During these 100 years we have come a long way, but we want to continue doing so for another 100 years. To do so, we need talented, curious, innovative, collaborative, diverse and responsible people to be part of this great team.


Benefits

  • Hybrid work
  • Flexible Schedule and early finish on Fridays, also during summer months
  • Attractive Compensation & Benefits package
  • Physiotherapist
  • Continuous learning and development
  • Ongoing feedback
  • Collaborative and challenging multinational environment
  • Strong values
  • Matrix organization
  • Open and transparent culture
  • Great work environment
  • Amazing people
  • and much more!


Would you like to join us?


If you what to know more about Hero, access our web site: www.hero.es

If you want to dive into our commitment to sustainability, access our 2023 Annual Report.

Excellent knowledge of Spanish and English languages

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a driven and successful Data Analyst to help our client sales teams worldwide grow, meet, and exceed their business targets.




As a Data Analyst focused on supporting the Sales team, you will be responsible for building and maintaining data and reporting capabilities, performing in-depth analysis of sales patterns, estimating the effectiveness of monetisation efforts, and providing actionable insights to both the sales teams and management.




You will contribute to key areas such as lead generation, user attribution infrastructure, and monetisation solutions, playing a critical role in driving revenue growth and expanding the brand‚Äôs customer base.




We need someone who is highly proficient with data infrastructure and reporting tools, understands the sales domain, and is genuinely interested in driving business outcomes.




What‚Äôs in it for you?




Great salary | High impact role | Scale up with high potential | Career growth | 100% Remote




Responsibilities:




Support the data infrastructure for sales: the company already has a basic data infrastructure in place, including a data warehouse (Redshift), integrated sales tools, and basic sales reporting in Tableau. They expect you to adapt this infrastructure to accommodate changes, develop more advanced reports, build new integrations, and ensure the quality and accuracy of the data.
Regularly report on the performance of the sales teams: Help develop and track appropriate KPIs.
Perform deep analysis of sales data: Focus primarily on internal data but also include external data where possible. Identify patterns and provide insights regarding offers, strategy changes, lead quality, and market shifts.
Work directly with sales teams, management, and, when necessary, marketing/development: Visualise and explain sales metrics and insights at various levels of complexity.
Form hypotheses, suggest improvements, and organise testing: Collaborate with the teams to test these hypotheses and implement improvements.




Requirements:




3+ years of experience in analytics/BI, ideally related to sales or marketing domains.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree, ideally with a focus on business administration, marketing, economics, or data processing (optional‚Äîcan be omitted if not critical).
Strong technical skills: Advanced SQL, ideally Python for automating tasks; understanding of basic statistics and A/B testing; experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker); and the ability to work with raw data.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to derive insights, form, and test hypotheses to improve business results.
Sales domain knowledge (familiarity with sales data and reporting, CRM systems, lead generation, and sales processes) is a significant advantage.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal: Ability to clearly explain complex analytical concepts to different audiences, from sales agents to company management.
Obsession with business results: Understanding of business impact and the ability to work independently or within a team to continuously improve outcomes.
Fluency in English (native-level preferred). Spanish is a significant advantage; Russian would also be beneficial.
Experience working with B2B apps in a growth stage is also a plus.




Ready to make a significant impact? If you‚Äôre a driven Data Analyst with a passion for sales and marketing analytics, we want to hear from you! Apply now via Prosperity and help drive growth and success for our client‚Äôs sales teams worldwide.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team.

If your passion lies in data, if you find joy in numbers and analysis, and if you're eager to bring value and want your voice to be heard, we extend an invitation for you to join our dynamic team.


ÔªøLocated in CET timezone +/-2h.


About Vimerson Health

We are a 100% remote and happiness-led company that encourages self-empowerment and forward-thinking. 

In just 9 short years since our inception, Vimerson Health has sold more than 9 million bottles of supplements, and we are continuing to grow and expand. We‚Äôre a global team dedicated to helping customers find health and happiness, one supplement at a time. Our team spans 12 countries, bringing knowledge and expertise from all over the world. We're growing FAST. There's a lot of opportunity to contribute to something special here. Join us!


PLEASE DO NOT HIT APPLY INSTEAD READ THE INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO APPLY. WE ARE NOT READING ANY APPLICATIONS ON LINKEDIN.


As Data Analyst, you will be Accountable for:

  • Analyzing data and providing insights that support business decisions;
  • Generating daily, weekly, monthly, and ad hoc reports using Google Sheets, PowerBI, and other business reporting tools;
  • Developing and monitoring key performance indicators;
  • Evaluating products‚Äô performance and proposing strategies to increase sales and profitability;
  • Setting up, tracking, and analyzing various promotions, suggesting strategies to maximize sales and profitability;
  • Developing pricing strategy and assessing the impact of price changes on product sales performance;
  • Conducting market research on products, competitors, prices, and segment-specific trends;
  • Enhancing efficiency through process automation.


Who are you?

  • You have outstanding skills and a minimum 2 years of experience analyzing sales and marketing data in a successful e-commerce company;
  • You have advanced analytical and quantitative skills as well as extensive knowledge of Google Sheets and Excel;
  • You have experience in developing analytical reporting and interactive dashboards in Power BI;
  • Your attention to detail is beyond all expectations;
  • You are passionate about developing hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, make recommendations, and drive actions;
  • You have the ability to communicate clearly and effectively, you collaborate effectively with teammates and management on problem definition and solving;
  • Upper-intermediate English with excellent written, communication, and presentation skills;
  • Located in CET timezone +/-2h.


We Offer:

  • A full-time remote job; 
  • Work in the Central European Time Zone with the flexibility of working hours;
  • Anniversary and Birthday bonuses;
  • 30 paid days off per year;
  • Parental leave;
  • Unlimited supply of Vimerson Health Supplements;
  • Charity Match Programme: The company will match any donations that you personally make to your charity of choice;
  • Recognition incentives and regular team-building activities;
  • Possibilities for personal and professional growth. 


Vimerson Health Core Company Values 

GROWTH MINDSET: we love learning, innovation, and new challenges. We challenge the status quo, set ambitious goals, and work smarter to achieve them.

DO WHAT YOU LOVE: we are passionate about the work we do. We do what we love, which makes us happier and more fulfilled.

OPEN & HONEST: we give and receive honest, constructive feedback. We actively engage in healthy conflict and constructive criticism for the greater good of the company.

ACCOUNTABLE: we do what we say, take ownership, and don‚Äôt make excuses.

CRITICAL THINKING: we make reasoned judgments that are logical, based on facts, and well-thought-out.

TEAM PLAYER: we genuinely care about, help, respect and support each other to perform well and reach our goals.


HOW TO APPLY 

If all of the above sounds like you, email your CV and a short cover letter in English, outlining your analytical experience and answering the following question: "Imagine our supplement company has experienced a 20% decline in sales on Amazon USA over the past quarter. You are tasked with investigating the possible causes of this decline. What steps would you take to identify the reasons behind the sales drop, and what types of data would you analyze? Please outline your approach in detail, including the key metrics and tools you would use."

Email hiring@vimerson.com, email title: Data Analyst. 


Please Note. You MUST live in Europe, ONLY applications with this cover letter will be considered. 

We look forward to reviewing your application!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Company

Shalion is a data-driven company working for world-class manufacturers and brands worldwide. With its Digital Shelf Optimization and Retail Media solutions, Shalion provides innovative tools that facilitate e-commerce monitoring.

We, at Shalion, enable brands to make smarter business decisions in eCommerce, based on actionable data and insights providing information on online product prices, availability, share of search, etc. in more than 800 e-retailers and 50 different countries. Our client portfolio includes industry giants such as Heineken, Lego, Danone, and Nestl√©.

The role

As a Data Analyst at Shalion, your responsibilities include:


Developing and maintaining client and internal dashboards in Looker.
Collaborating with Product teams to shape the product roadmap based on customer feedback and market insights.
Translating business requirements into technical tasks, ensuring timely delivery.
Working closely with Data Engineers to expand and enhance datasets, contributing to roadmap planning.
Ensuring data quality and consistency across dashboards.
Translating product questions into actionable insights.
Support the team in solving problems and challenges related to reporting and information analysis to create best practices in data usage and consumption.


Your profile should include the following:


2+ years of experience working as a data analyst or visualization expert.
Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.
High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or Power BI.
Solid statistical background.
Experience working with business stakeholders and engineers.
Experience in data modeling for visualization.
Communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to structure information, analyze it, and extract data according to business needs


Ideally you will also have:


An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.
Experience with market research analysis.
Experience working with a modern cloud data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
Knowledge of Git and command-line
Prior experience modeling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).
UX skills.


Soft Skills:


Prioritization: Skillful at prioritizing tasks, gaining stakeholder buy-in, and resolving conflicts.
Resilience: Able to thrive in ambiguous situations and enjoy problem-solving.
Curiosity: Eagerness to learn and engage in constructive discussions.
Quality-oriented: Can discern data quality and value code testing for growth.


What We Offer You


The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
International environment with more than 10 nationalities
Fresh fruit every day
Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarri√†- Sant Gervasi).
Fixed-term contract.


Interview process


First interview HR screening
Second interview SQL assignment
Third interview CDO

About The Company

Shalion is a data-driven company working for world-class manufacturers and brands worldwide. With its Digital Shelf Optimization and Retail Media solutions, Shalion provides innovative tools that facilitate e-commerce monitoring.

We, at Shalion, enable brands to make smarter business decisions in eCommerce, based on actionable data and insights providing information on online product prices, availability, share of search, etc. in more than 800 e-retailers and 50 different countries. Our client portfolio includes industry giants such as Heineken, Lego, Danone, and Nestl√©.

The role

As a Data Analyst at Shalion, your responsibilities include:

  • Developing and maintaining client and internal dashboards in Looker.
  • Collaborating with Product teams to shape the product roadmap based on customer feedback and market insights.
  • Translating business requirements into technical tasks, ensuring timely delivery.
  • Working closely with Data Engineers to expand and enhance datasets, contributing to roadmap planning.
  • Ensuring data quality and consistency across dashboards.
  • Translating product questions into actionable insights.
  • Support the team in solving problems and challenges related to reporting and information analysis to create best practices in data usage and consumption.

Your profile should include the following:

  • 2+ years of experience working as a data analyst or visualization expert.
  • Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.
  • High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or Power BI.
  • Solid statistical background.
  • Experience working with business stakeholders and engineers.
  • Experience in data modeling for visualization.
  • Communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to structure information, analyze it, and extract data according to business needs

Ideally you will also have:

  • An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.
  • Experience with market research analysis.
  • Experience working with a modern cloud data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
  • Knowledge of Git and command-line
  • Prior experience modeling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)
  • Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).
  • UX skills.

Soft Skills:

  • Prioritization: Skillful at prioritizing tasks, gaining stakeholder buy-in, and resolving conflicts.
  • Resilience: Able to thrive in ambiguous situations and enjoy problem-solving.
  • Curiosity: Eagerness to learn and engage in constructive discussions.
  • Quality-oriented: Can discern data quality and value code testing for growth.

What We Offer You

  • The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
  • Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
  • To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
  • Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
  • The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
  • A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
  • International environment with more than 10 nationalities
  • Fresh fruit every day
  • Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarri√†- Sant Gervasi).
  • Fixed-term contract.

Interview process

  • First interview HR screening
  • Second interview SQL assignment
  • Third interview CDO

  • Que est√©s habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gesti√≥n de informaci√≥n, an√°lisis de BBDD y elaboraci√≥n de informes.
  • Valoraremos experiencia en creaci√≥n de modelos estad√≠sticos con diferentes metodolog√≠as.
  • Que conozcas lenguajes de programaci√≥n estad√≠stica (SAS-SQL, R, Phyton), as√≠ como dominio del paquete Office.
  • Valoraremos que aportes un correcto nivel de Ingl√©s (sobre todo a nivel de comprensi√≥n).


Banco Sabadell est√° comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selecci√≥n, formaci√≥n y promoci√≥n ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminaci√≥n por motivo de g√©nero, edad, orientaci√≥n sexual, religi√≥n, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst with proven experience in Python,SQL, analytics and knowledge of statistics to join our Data Science Team. Working alongside our Data Engineers, the candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!

The role is based in Barcelona!

Your tasks and responsibilities:


Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to address strategic questions
Obtain and Report insights from our Product¬¥s performance (ML, Audiences, Creatives, Supply, etc) in order to make decisions that will impact revenue. Have one¬¥s say!
Develop automated dashboards and processes to ensure data influence decisions at all levels of the company
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance


Skills and requirements:


+2 years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Engineering or Business
Strong knowledge of basic statistics concepts
Strong analytical skills with the ability to get insights
Outstanding communication and reporting skills
Excellent command of Microsoft Excel (Power Pivot & Power Query)
Excellent communication skills in English both written and spoken are mandatory
Strong experience with SQL for data exploratory analysis
Experience with A/B testing
R, Superset, PowerBI experience is a plus
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus


Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:


Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbeque, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - TicketRestaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28countries
And more!


Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us




We are a multinational food company that conserves the goodness of nature in our products. We carefully select our fruit and vegetables from their origin, maintaining the highest quality and safety throughout the production process.




We pride ourselves in providing consumers with natural, healthy, and nutritious products that have made us a reference in infant and adult nutrition. In addition, the Hero Institute of Infant Nutrition is within the Hero Spain facilities.




Website: www.hero.es




Sector: Food company




Company size: More than 4,000 employees




Headquarters: Lenzburg, Switzerland




Company type: Private company




Categories: Baby food, Healthy Snacks, Natural Spreads, Sauces, Juices and Nectars, Cereal Snacks, Prepared meals




What is our commitment?




We are on a mission to delight consumers by conserving the goodness of nature. The world today is different from what it was 10 years ago, and nothing like it was in 1886 when Hero was founded in Lenzburg, Switzerland. However, our core goals remain the same. We have adapted to change, offering consumers high quality, healthy, natural and sustainable food.




Hero Spain, with its headquarter in Alcantarilla (Murcia), has formed part of this legacy since 1922. We are committed to naturalness in our products, maintaining a firm nutritional commitment and constantly improving thanks to our commitment to continuous innovation and research, to adapt to the needs of consumers, customers, and new market trends.




Team value proposition




Recently, Hero Spain has been certified as a #TopEmployer in 2023 and 2024 üèÜ, an achievement that reflects our ongoing commitment to the well-being and development of our team of talents. This recognition is a testament to the exceptional culture we have cultivated together, positioning us as one of the best companies to work for in Spain. This would not have been possible without the commitment and dedication of every person who is part of the Hero family.




We don't hire top talent so we can tell them what to do. That doesn't make sense. At Hero, we give you the opportunity to make your mark and contribute to something bigger. We‚Äôll give you the tools and skills to do your job and then get out of the way.




Purpose




We are on a mission to conserve what's good in nature. We do so by striving to conduct our business sustainably and striving to do the right thing. Always. Without compromises.




Values

The new values reflect the company today and the company we want to build in the future. Values are at the heart of who we are as people and they guide how we behave.




Create wow

We dare to do things differently, seek to always win with consumers and customers, and endeavor to be forever relevant and vital to our world. It‚Äôs about Curiosity, Innovation and Consumer/Customer Focus.

Everyone Hero

We work together in pursuit of our common mission and strategy, strengthening our local businesses by leveraging the power of the collective. It‚Äôs about Purpose, Performance and Teamwork.

Nourish others

We treat everyone with honesty, care and respect and provide our people, customers and consumers with what they need to thrive. It‚Äôs about Honesty, Empowerment, Respect and Diversity.

Take responsibility

We make good choices today to build a more sustainable business and environment fit for the needs of tomorrow. It‚Äôs about Sustainability, Ownership, Heritage and Quality.




Impact




We value good ideas, so we want the best talent. Our people can make a difference because we give them the freedom to act, to be entrepreneurial, and to make a difference. This is reflected in the responsibilities. Be yourself, be impactful.




Growth




We all win if we grow together. It's about professional and personal growth. The best way to grow as a company is to help you grow as a person, hence the availability of learning and development opportunities.




Meet you future department




The Finance department owns the financial close process and produces financial statements and reports to guide strategic decision-making.




How can you help us?




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights and generate ideas that drive strategic decision-making within the company. Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.




Your main responsibilities




Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, including internal databases, SAP systems, and other relevant data sources.
Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to different departments.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement through data analysis.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.




Academic Background




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a business environment.
Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, with particular value placed on Power BI.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Platform, Databases, DAX.




Skills and competences




Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into meaningful information, as well as representing it in graphical and visual reports.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Results-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.




Others




Based in Spain




What do we offer you?




(Confidentiality is assured)

During these 100 years we have come a long way, but we want to continue doing so for another 100 years. To do so, we need talented, curious, innovative, collaborative, diverse and responsible people to be part of this great team.




Benefits

Hybrid work
Flexible Schedule and early finish on Fridays, also during summer months
Attractive Compensation & Benefits package
Physiotherapist
Continuous learning and development
Ongoing feedback
Collaborative and challenging multinational environment
Strong values
Matrix organization
Open and transparent culture
Great work environment
Amazing people
and much more!




Would you like to join us?




If you what to know more about Hero, access our web site: www.hero.es

If you want to dive into our commitment to sustainability, access our 2023 Annual Report.

How can you help us?


As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights and generate ideas that drive strategic decision-making within the company. Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.


Your main responsibilities


  • Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, including internal databases, SAP systems, and other relevant data sources.
  • Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to different departments.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement through data analysis.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
  • Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
  • Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
  • Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.


Academic Background


  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
  • Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.
  • Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a business environment.
  • Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, with particular value placed on Power BI.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Platform, Databases, DAX.


Skills and competences


  • Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into meaningful information, as well as representing it in graphical and visual reports.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
  • Results-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

  • Based in Spain


What do we offer you?


(Confidentiality is assured)

During these 100 years we have come a long way, but we want to continue doing so for another 100 years. To do so, we need talented, curious, innovative, collaborative, diverse and responsible people to be part of this great team.


Benefits

  • Hybrid work
  • Flexible Schedule and early finish on Fridays, also during summer months
  • Attractive Compensation & Benefits package

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Company

Shalion is a data-driven company working for world-class manufacturers and brands worldwide. With its Digital Shelf Optimization and Retail Media solutions, Shalion provides innovative tools that facilitate e-commerce monitoring.

We, at Shalion, enable brands to make smarter business decisions in eCommerce, based on actionable data and insights providing information on online product prices, availability, share of search, etc. in more than 800 e-retailers and 50 different countries. Our client portfolio includes industry giants such as Heineken, Lego, Danone, and Nestl√©.

The role

As a Data Analyst at Shalion, your responsibilities include:


Developing and maintaining client and internal dashboards in Looker.
Collaborating with Product teams to shape the product roadmap based on customer feedback and market insights.
Translating business requirements into technical tasks, ensuring timely delivery.
Working closely with Data Engineers to expand and enhance datasets, contributing to roadmap planning.
Ensuring data quality and consistency across dashboards.
Translating product questions into actionable insights.
Support the team in solving problems and challenges related to reporting and information analysis to create best practices in data usage and consumption.


Your profile should include the following:


2+ years of experience working as a data analyst or visualization expert.
Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.
High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or Power BI.
Solid statistical background.
Experience working with business stakeholders and engineers.
Experience in data modeling for visualization.
Communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to structure information, analyze it, and extract data according to business needs


Ideally you will also have:


An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.
Experience with market research analysis.
Experience working with a modern cloud data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
Knowledge of Git and command-line
Prior experience modeling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)
Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).
UX skills.


Soft Skills:


Prioritization: Skillful at prioritizing tasks, gaining stakeholder buy-in, and resolving conflicts.
Resilience: Able to thrive in ambiguous situations and enjoy problem-solving.
Curiosity: Eagerness to learn and engage in constructive discussions.
Quality-oriented: Can discern data quality and value code testing for growth.


What We Offer You


The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
International environment with more than 10 nationalities
Fresh fruit every day
Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarri√†- Sant Gervasi).
Fixed-term contract.


Interview process


First interview HR screening
Second interview SQL assignment
Third interview CDO

  • 2+ years of experience working as a data analyst or visualization expert.
  • Hands-on and strong working knowledge of SQL.
  • High experience level with modern visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Qlik Sense, or Power BI.
  • Solid statistical background.
  • Experience working with business stakeholders and engineers.
  • Experience in data modeling for visualization.
  • Communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to structure information, analyze it, and extract data according to business needs

Ideally you will also have:

  • An advanced degree in a quantitative field such as math, physics, computer science, statistics, etc.
  • Experience with market research analysis.
  • Experience working with a modern cloud data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
  • Knowledge of Git and command-line
  • Prior experience modeling data in LookML and dbt (data build tool)
  • Be fluent with one or more common data-related programming languages (Python or R).
  • UX skills.

Soft Skills:

  • Prioritization: Skillful at prioritizing tasks, gaining stakeholder buy-in, and resolving conflicts.
  • Resilience: Able to thrive in ambiguous situations and enjoy problem-solving.
  • Curiosity: Eagerness to learn and engage in constructive discussions.
  • Quality-oriented: Can discern data quality and value code testing for growth.

What We Offer You

  • The possibility to contribute to developing a company-wide data direction, processes, and standards.
  • Hybrid work: one remote day and four days of in-office work to boost our productivity and promote a work-life balance.
  • To be part of a high-performing team in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
  • Talented, diverse, and very friendly work environment;
  • The fast-growing project, where you can grow and develop
  • A challenging project, where you can have great contributions and impact
  • International environment with more than 10 nationalities
  • Fresh fruit every day
  • Office with a good location in Barcelona (Sarri√†- Sant Gervasi).
  • Fixed-term contract.

Interview process

  • First interview HR screening
  • Second interview SQL assignment
  • Third interview CDO

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math or a similar area;
  • Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools (for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.);
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCS/Data_Analyst‚Äù.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 740 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.




üîéWe are looking for a Data Analyst







YOUR MISSIONS:




Work in close collaboration with the Development team and other stakeholders to improve interactions and maintain full transparency within the squad.
Help squads deliver value effectively.
Establish and oversee a data management framework, defining data ownership, data lineage, and implementing data quality controls.
Ensure that all events are conducted as scheduled, with participants understanding their objectives, and facilitate comprehension of the framework, its principles, and best practices.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by conducting regular data audits and validation.
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for data processes and analyses.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Solid knowledge and experience in reporting and ETL development with Power BI and Alteryx
Understanding of data visualization tools
SQL development skills
PL/SQL development skills
Knowledge of data privacy regulations
Fluent in English
Hybrid regime in the Porto office




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Data Analyst - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

‚Ç¨40,000 - ‚Ç¨45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst (HYBRID @Porto)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: +3 years

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week in Porto)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics;
3+ years of experience as Data Analyst;
Proficiency with ETL, SQL, PowerBI and Alteryx;
Experience with Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python and Tibco Spotfire are nice to have;
Ability to perform database queries;
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills;
Strong attention to detail and accuracy;
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you¬¥ll have (plus):

Comfort speaking French.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Support Analyst
Description:
Who is Clever?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.




Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.




Where will I work from?

Porto, Portugal.




What is my department like?

Our Technology Department is the driving force behind the innovations that propel our company forward. Committed to creating scalable and high-quality solutions, we work in a collaborative environment where every idea matters. Our teams of experts in development, infrastructure, security, and data intelligence are driven by a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering impactful results. We value diversity of thought and believe that the best solutions arise from collaboration between diverse and creative minds




What is my role like?

We are looking for a dedicated and detail-oriented Data Support Analyst to join our Data Management team. The ideal candidate will have effective communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively with various departments, ensuring that data operations are executed with accuracy and efficiency.




What will my daily tasks involve?

Assist the Data Management team in interacting with other departments, facilitating communication and collaboration to ensure that data projects meet the needs of all stakeholders.
Manage and resolve first-level support tickets related to data, including issues with dashboards, RPA bots, and data loading processes.
Monitor and ensure that dashboard loads are executed correctly, identifying and resolving any performance or loading issues.
Validate bots developed by the RPA team, ensuring they function as expected and comply with established requirements.
Create and maintain detailed documentation for data processes, RPA bots, and support procedures, ensuring that information is always up-to-date and accessible.




What is expected from me?

Minimum of 1 year of experience in data support, data analysis, or similar roles.
Familiarity with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Basic knowledge of SQL and ETL practices.
Ability to maintain technical documentation.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively.
Attention to detail and accuracy when working with data are differentiating factors.




What can I expect from Clever?

A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access,complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Clever Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.




At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed.




Ready to make a Clever choice?

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a project of international scope, with a client that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

üíª THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project in the banking sector.

üí° What We're Looking For

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field;
  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Strong proficiency in Python (proven experience developing data-related Python frameworks is a plus);
  • Knowledge on Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop, Airflow and Presto (proven experience is a plus);
  • Proficiency in SQL queries and a good understanding of database architecture;
  • Experience creating data sources and dashboards on Tableau and PowerBI;
  • Familiarity with in-house big data platforms;
  • Strong analytical skills to ensure data quality;
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative and multi-cultural team environment;
  • Fluency in English;

‚≠ê What You Can Expect From Us

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360¬∞ evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DA/AT/MO‚Äù.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Service Data Analyst - Trainee
HTML:
Euronext is the leading pan-European market infrastructure, connecting European economies to global capital markets, to accelerate innovation and sustainable growth. It operates regulated exchanges in Belgium, France, Ireland, Italy, the Netherlands, Norway and Portugal. With close to 2,000 listed issuers and around ‚Ç¨6.6 trillion in market capitalization as of end March 2022, it has an unmatched blue-chip franchise and a strong diverse domestic and international client base. Euronext operates regulated and transparent equity and derivatives markets, one of Europe's leading electronic fixed income trading markets and is the largest center for debt and funds listings in the world. Its total product offering includes Equities, FX, Exchange Traded Funds, Warrants & Certificates, Bonds, Derivatives, Commodities and Indices. The Group provides a multi-asset clearing house through Euronext Clearing, and custody and settlement services through Euronext Securities central securities depositories in Denmark, Italy, Norway and Portugal. Euronext also leverages its expertise in running markets by providing technology and managed services to third parties. In addition to its main regulated market, it also operates a number of junior markets, simplifying access to listing for SMEs.

Job Description

The Service Data Analyst is responsible for the ongoing service improvement activities within the IT service delivery lifecycle and looks for opportunities to improve the performance of services to deliver enhanced value to the business.
The selected candidate will be part of a team based in Porto and will work in a high-tech, fast learning environment, with colleagues across all Euronext locations.
You will act as an ITIL expert in the analysis and development of existing processes, analytics' procedures and methods to promote effective business intelligence and systems operations through standardization, automation and data integration and modeling. You will establish strong and productive relationships with key stakeholders ensuring that the service requirements of the business are incorporated into a framework of continuous improvement.

Key Accountabilities

- Developing Large Data Models to provide stakeholders with valuable Business Intelligence;

- Creating RPA solutions to increase the efficiency of the established workflows;
- Analyzing the service delivery process;
- Gathering and assessing KPIs, reporting process performance information to recommend, develop and implement improvements;
- Ensuring standardization and efficiency in workflows;
- Develop and document Service Data Analytics' own procedures and tools;
- Provide support and guidance to the technical teams as they implement service management policies, ensuring the quality throughout the implementation;
- Prepare and conduct training sessions to establish new tools and procedures, presenting them to a wide range of stakeholders within the company;
- Creative thinking and presenting ideas for business improvement.

Profile and Skills

Essential:
- Degree in a related field - IEFP Level VI;
- Excellent communication skills, both oral and written;
- English is a must, as it will be used on a daily basis to communicate with other teams and stakeholders;
- Excellent interpersonal skills;
- An affinity with Microsoft Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, ect.


Desirable:
- Interest in financial markets;
- Awareness of ITIL framework and processes;
- Knowledge of programming language (SQL/Python/DAX/MDX/PowerQuery);
- Experience in RPA and business analytics tools (such as Power Automate and Power BI)

Soft Skills

- A hands-on mentality and a structured way of working;
- The ambition and potential to develop a successful IT career;
- Ability to multi-task and prioritize;
-Strong awareness and interest in technology;
- Superb problem solving skills;
- Solution oriented attitude;
- Experience in working effectively within a team and on your own;
- Excellent organizational skills;
- Creativity and lateral thinking;
- Enthusiasm and desire to learn.


We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against individuals on the basis of race, gender, age, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or any other legally protected factor. We value the unique talents of all our people, who come from diverse backgrounds with different personal experiences and points of view and we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect.

Title: Lead Insight Analyst
Description:
Lead Insight Analyst required to joining our rapidly expanding Data Analytics team on a permanent basis in Portugal.

The opportunity:

As a Lead Insight Analyst you will have the opportunity to work on some of our largest projects and key accounts. Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics, you will be responsible for analysing digital behaviour in order to provide key, actionable insight and critical recommendations to our clients. This is more than just an insight role; it‚Äôs an opportunity to help shape the digital strategies of some of the world‚Äôs leading brands and retailers! You will be tool agnostic and you will use tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for tracking data, GTM, Adobe Launch or Tealium for implementing tags and a mixture of data visualization tool as well as Excel and Powerpoint for visualisation. Additionally, you will be managing a small team of Analysts and will be providing oversight to ensure that their delivering tool quality analysis outputs.

Please note that this job is a full-time position located in Lisbon or Porto, but the selection process will be conducted in English.

Please send over your CV in English




What you‚Äôll be doing:

Shaping, sell and deliver large analytics programs of work.
Creating measurement plans that identify the customer behaviour to be tracked (you will work closely with our implementation analysts for this)
Establishing detailed reporting and visualisations that help our clients understand the performance of their digital channels
Using measurement tools to analyse digital user behaviours in detail, across a wide range of digital properties (websites, mobile applications, instore devices)
Creating detailed insight reports that cover key findings and recommendations
Presenting your findings to a senior-level client audience and helping them understand what it means for their business
Working with our internal UX and design teams to inform the creation of new websites and apps
Answering client queries and running training sessions with them
Having line management duties for a small team of analysts, including developing their skillset and driving the quality of their work

What we want from you:

Extensive experience working as a Lead Analyst providing insight, ideally in an ecommerce setting (client or agency)
Must have Advanced practical knowledge of Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square)
Numerically adept in using Excel (or similar) to analyse data
Previous experience supporting junior team members
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint
Extensive experience working with senior client stakeholders
Effective time management and multitasking abilities
A proven track record of delivering large insight projects for leading B2C organisations

What we can offer you:

Alongside the opportunity to work with some of the most exciting brands around the world, we‚Äôll also prioritise your career development and help you grow your skills. We‚Äôll empower you to make a difference, allow you to be yourself, and respect who you are.

We offer a great benefits package including hybrid working that works for everyone, social events, training opportunities, medical and dental insurance, life assurance, meal cards and much more.

Our personality and behaviours: We believe that we are what we do, not just what we say. Our shared values and behaviours show how to bring the VML Enterprise Solution's culture to life through the actions we all take every day:

Connect Meaningfully
Inspire Creatively
Include Purposefully
Approach Positively




Our brilliant, talented people are what makes VML Enterprise Solutions what we are. That‚Äôs why we look for people who go beyond and always push our thinking to be better than yesterday.

AT VML Enterprise Solutions

Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world‚Äôs leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands.

We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestl√©, Sainsbury‚Äôs, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We‚Äôve built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business.

As our business grows internationally, we‚Äôre looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client‚Äôs successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

In our Lisbon or Porto office, you‚Äôll join a team of other specialists who are always ready to help each other. The team is part of our Enterprise Solutions network and works in coordination with our Local and EMEA client leads.

#LI-EMEA #LI-HYBRID #LI-JM1
